restitutio magistrate contending among themselues office home army abroade power like prince monarkes made leader seditious army would leaue army deliuered people without authoritie would leuie straunge souldiers enimies striuing whether first get citie word cotrary factio deede ye countrey inuaded enemy cruell murder vsed others proscription deathe banishment consiscations torment intollerable kinde crueltie left undone till cornelius sylla one mightie captaines rebellion fifty yeares gracchus healing euil euil made himselfe monarke time kinde officer called dictator vsed daungerous time commonly giuen ouer sixe monethes ended sylla deede dictator force dictator vvas ruled alone yet battell might horsebacke perpetuall yet speach pretending elected fill rule alone first man thinke durst freely giue ouer tiranicall power affirming woulde aunswere doings woulde accuse sighte sortes priuate man many time went common place returned home againe without hurte suche feare yet aucthoritie beheld hym astonishmente resigning reuerence hee offered aunsweare hys doyngs curtesie consideration acknowledging tyranny haue bene profitable countrey thus sedition ceassed sylla remedie euils sylla done hym began againe caesar conquered fraunce passed floud e sayled england til caius caesar election sent gouerne fraunce long time comauded senate giue ouer aunswered pompey enimie leading army italy repining authoritie fraunce sought remoue senate yet notwithstading propounded coditions eyther shoulde reteyne armyes anoyde caesar offreth condition suspition perill pompey also leaue power liue priuate life according lawes obteyning neyther marched fraunce pompey countrey inuated hymthe place vv called harsalia vvhich pompey fled egypt vvhere vvas killed yong king senate gracchus toke gracchus senate holde offer thinking euery reasonable man wylling lawe ranne senate house reproued rich among chiefe men vvord signifyeth great men streight straight hee ranne resistance againe wherefore gracchus put matter firste vayces one company giuen octauius gracchus turned prayed leaue purpose cared proceeded fiue thirtie company whereoffiue thirtie company rome seauenteene giuen greate furie eyghtenth haue determined matter gracchus againe sighte people lamentably desired daunger woulde hynder profitable honorable acte italy withstande greate desire people serue hee made decree octauius beeyng depriued secretely conueyed hymselfe away octauius depri ed q mummius chosen lavv landes officer lavv appius claudius quintus mummius chosen tribune place lawe landes pronounced firste officer appoynted see executed gracchus hymselfe lawmaker brother hys name appius claudius hys father lawe muche dyd people feare laboure lawe shoulde bee lost vnlesse gracchus hys familie hadde execution gracchus maruellously magnifyed thys lawe accompanyed people house preseruer one citie countrey nation italy thys beeyng done day returned landes countrey whence came purpose lost day remayned discontented talked gracchus shoulde escape blame shoulde bee office durst violate magistrate greate authoritie gyue occasion manifest sedition italy nowe sommer tyme choosing tribune hande seemed ryche woulde laboure office bee gyuen gracchus greatest enimies tryall beeyng hande hee afrayde hee shoulde bee elected tribune yeare come called people countrey gyue voyce election beeyng occupyed sommer businesse daye drawyng nygh hee gracchus labour people compelled make people citie hys refuge wente aboute euery one aparte desire make hym tribune agayne beeyng daunger theyr sake daye come two firste companyes chose gracchus ryche men cryed lawfull one bee tribune twyce togyther rubrio tribune whose turne came bee chiefe election doubted matter mummius doubt election successor octauius prayed hys fellowe committe order election hym whyche hee dyd tribune affyrmed thys must tryed lotte rubrio hadde hys turne appoyntmente dyd apperteyne contention beeyng greate gracchus hauyng worse deferred discussing tyll nexte daye beeyng vtterlye discouraged although yet office remayned rest whole daye common place beseechyng euerye man bee hys helpe though shoulde streyghte haue bin destroyed hys enimies poore men moued wyth compassion consideryng vsed indifferently citizen rather slaues lust ryche fearyng gracchus state suffered theyr sake lamentation broughte hym hys house nyghte bade hym bee good cheere agaynste nexte daye gracchus beeyng thus encouraged assembled hys parte nyghte gaue watchworde fyghte neede required hee went temple capitoll election shoulde bee assemblie come togyther hee myddest tribune ryche men woulde suffer election proceede hym wherefore hee gaue hys watche worde priuie made greate shoute beganne fray stoode aboute gracchus tumult b gracchus guarde hys person tore seates wrang roddes mace sergeantes handes rente asunder euerye thyng bet ryche menne place wyth suche tumulte terroure tribune ranne awaye priestes shutte temple dores flying running confused speeche well vnderstanded thoughte gracchus hadde deposed tribune spying none lyke bee thoughte hee hadde made hym selfe tribune agayne wythoute anye felte continuall gayne vsed theyr authoritie rigorouslye moderately brought priuie accusours rich faction force ouerthrew lawes corruption custome triall iudgementes vtterly ouerthrowne new returned rome gathered sixe thousand al italie written africa wolues destroyed plat citie gracchus fuluius layd southsayers affirmed inhabitantes vnlucky wherefore senate called counsell lawe ofinhabitance reuoked inhabitance might reuoked gracchus fuluius deceyued hope also like mad men sayd senate lye touching token wolues vuruly sorte comons fauouring came weapos capitoll assemblie shoulde inhabitance whe people assembled fuluius beganne speake gracchus came vp capitoll garded priuie purpose resisted vnderstoode woulde make new businesse lefte way capitell tooke lowe gallerie wayting deceyue aduersaries one attilius attilius man commo sort seeyng turmoyles making sacrifice gallerie came tooke hym hand eyther persuade suspecting otherwise talke prayed woulde spare countrey hee troubled fearing apprehended looked angerly vpo whereat one people without commandement token giuen coiecture gracchus grimme looke thought time please captayne began fray drew sword ranne attilius greate attilius killed shoute made head body seene among euery man fledde temple feare lyke displeasure gracchus wente common place minding say somewhat people touching facte man woulde harken gracchus acte detested euery detesting wicked fact gracchus flacchus hope hauing lost occasion thoughte haue preuented ranne home house accompanyed companion rest people time daunger midnight tooke common place breake day opimius consull appoynted men armoure tol opimius keepe capitoll called senate togither publike officer himselfe meane time abiding temple iupiters child prouide necessitie thus ordeyned senate sent gracchus fuluius aunswere themselues counsell house armoure wente hill called auentine hoping strength place auentine vvas one seauen h l rome bring senate composition offered libertie bondman would repayre vnto man made anye accompt wherefore tooke temple diana fortifyed sent quintus sonne flaccus vnto senatesecond seditio requesting pause truce concord senate willed leaue armoure come say could themselues else sende neuerthelesse hee came agayne opimius consull taking messenger bycause disobedience caused deteyned sent souldiours gracchus sledde ouer woodden bridge vnto side floude groue wyththe vvoodden bridge vvas part tiber goeth hill ianiculo one man whome saw shoulde taken offered throte cutte flaccus fledde shoppe one hys acquaintance followed threatned burne whole streete vnlesse deliuered friend ashamed betray calamitie bade flaccus taken killed head brought gracchus fuluius slayne gracchus vvas eloquent vehement vvould moue vp dovvne cast govvne hys shoulder purgation citie temple concorde lavv sell lande diuision money sp borius consull opimius gaue waight gold reward people spoyled house consull tooke co panions committed till executed quintus granted choose maner death would purged citie bloudshed senate sentence erected teple concord comon place ende gracchus second seditio long lawe made anye man might sel land yt controuersie former gracchus forhidden whereby riche men agayne dyd buy poore men part thrust violence til spurius borius tribune deuise law yt land shuld deuided remaine owner tribute raysed people money whereof distributed wherby poore reliefe increase help al thus gracchus law abrogated sleight might haue bin good profitable bin vsed accordingly log tribune distribution also take away people vtterly destitute al help whereof followed wante citizen souldyers reuenewe lande stipende lawes space fifteene yeares gracchus lawe quietnesse meane tymea theatre vvas place playes bee seene people vvas round sauing one place amp theatre vvas round euerye vvhere sometime theatre serued people learne oratios q metellus censor nonius called memmius mumius nonius killed matter author see meth varie scipio consull threw downe theatre lucius cassius begun almost ended eyther occasion new sedition woulde haue romaine people acquainted greekes pastime q metellus maister maners minded haue remoued glaucias bin consul apuleius hauing bin tribune dignitie euill life coulde bycause fellowe againste little reuenged metellus apuleius laboured bee tribune againe bycause glaucias pretor chiefe election nonius noble vsing free speech agaynste reprouing glaucias chosen tribune fearyng authoritie would punish sent band busie fellowes went election killed entring shoppe saue himselfe murther committed glaucias faction people could assemble agayne hose apuleius tribune earely morning meane deathe nonius followed men afraide tribune metellus banished help c marius sixe metellus c marius vvas enimie nobilitie laborer sonne voyde learning rude manner yet good souldiour vvhen scipio vnder vvhome serued spayne vvas asked vvhome hee thought meete generall hee clapped marius shoulder sayd peraduenture time consull bearing secrete hate againste conspired enimies apuleius make lawe deuide certayne landes frenche wonne cymbrianes whome marius hadde driuen away nowe longer frenche belongyng romaine therefore might deuided promised people woulde allow lawe senate confirme fifth day oth refused sweare remoued fro senate codemned people twenty talent deuice reuenged metellus grauitie woulde sweare vnto law forwardnesse apuleius appointed yt day meane time sent ye countrey serued marius warres haue help bycause italian shoulde aduaunced lawe romaine people content discord arose time meeting apuleius put backe higher place allobiection lavv law people citie cryed th ndered hapned lawfull romaine thunder stoppeth proceeding election assembly citizen countreymen lavve vvonne force marius dissembleth conclude thing consultation neuerthelesse apuleius bande vsed violence still wherefore citizen girded gownes tooke weapon woode coulde get resisted countreymen agayne encouraged apuleius stucke staues battes beate citizen lawe wonne marius consull forthwith propouded oth bycause knew metellus constant sound man purpose firste shewed owne opinion affirming would sweare deceyue metellus sayd wherefore beyng commended others marius brake vp house fifth daye time appoynted oth consull assembled senate suddaine tenne clocke sayde afrayd people fauored lawe feruentlya deuice marius illude lavve vvords nonlatin alphabet nonlatin alphabet commentum subtil yet deuised shift subtiltie man might sweare word lawe farre forthe lawfull time countrey people mighte sente home might well proued law violence thundering iupiter made contrary order countrey whe sayd thus euery man silent feare entrapping suddaynesse time wherefore arose went temple saturne common treasourers shoulde sweare himselfe sware first frieds senator like feare metellus would sweare continuing metellus refuseth oth former sentence without dread apuleius nexte day sent sergeant pull courte tribune defended apuleius claudius ranne countrey multitude affirming neither could haue lad law take place vnlesse metellus banished wherefore decree banishmente made proclamation consull man succoure metellus neyther wyth fyre water one day giuen deliberation matter people citie offended andthe moderatio metellus wente aboute metellus weapon thanked good said countrey brought trouble apuleius pronounced decree exile metellus banished marius confirmed thus worthy man citie banished apuleius tribune third time fellow one gracchus runnagate appoynted gracchus runnagate vvho vvas aduanced marius reporting sonne olde gracchus people fauouring name sake election consul hand marcus antonius chosen one without sticking glaucias memmius contended memmius estimation citie glaucias apuleius feared themselues sente certayne men waster assemblie whiche layde vpon memmius kylled memmius killed thus solemne assemblie disturbed regarde law iustice reuerece god man people greeued nexte day gathered togither dispatche apuleius got company new multitude countreyme glaucias c sapheius treasourer tooke capitoll senate commaunded shoulde taken dispatched marius vnwilling shew arme men slowly cutte away water wente temple wherefore sapheius could abide lacke water persuaded set temple fyre glaucias apuleius yeelded themselues first sapheius euery man called vpon execution marius shutte senate house deale according lawe people perceiuing delay pulled staues roofe teple neuer left throwing vpon till killed three sapheius glauclas apuleius killed whereof one questor tribune canuleius metellus dutifull tribune next yeare accuse furius people would tarrie haue tried iudgement teare furius torne peeces peeces thus euer one mischiefe committed common place metellus called home say daye suffice came welcome hym metellus reuoked home gate citie thus thirde sedition two former made two gracc begunne apulesus thirde sedition working muche trouble romaynes ended meane tyme kyndled stirre called fellowes warre whiche sodayne shortlye grewe verye great caused dissention ceasse home feare trouble abrode ended raysed newe turmoyles worker discorde makyng city creating officer among people wyth myghtye armyes seekyng one anothers destruction whyche thought good ioyne thys hystorie bycause proceeded ciuill dissention increased farre greater tumulte begynnyng whereof thys fuluiu flaccus beeyng consull fyrste openly encouragedfellovves vva cause italian aske freedome rome subiectes myghte bee coequall authoritie bycause hee earnest cause senatoures sente hym forrayne warre hee laboured bee tribune flaccus se beria hys office shoulde ende broughte passe hee chosen tribune wyth gracchus yonger whyche going aboute make lawes fauoure italian slayne yee haue hearde whereby italian sharplyesette takyng greeuouslye rather vsed lyke vnderlyngs fellowes fuluius gracchus theyr sake destroyed whome liuius drusus aliuius drusus noble man tribune hadde promised italian make lawe theyr fauoure touchyng freedome citie whereof verye desirous onely meane seruauntes bee made superioures gratifye people rome tribune ledde newe inhabitances well italie sicelie determined tyll tyme deferred hee also tooke hande make pacification betweene senatoures gentleman whyche fallen authoritie iudiciall matter hee sawe hee coulde directlye restore senate theyr former iurisdiction vsed policie wyth senate reason sedition scarcely number three hundred hee deuised many shoulde bee chosen gentleman judge bee chosen tyme toencrease senator come heare matter corruption whyche nowe regarded men waxen shamelesse thoughte faulte thys policie hadde contrarie successe senate greeued many gentleman shoulde suddaynely bee made theyr fellowes beeyng vnlyke lyke authoritie would agree gentleman afrayde whole order iudgementes senate thing hauing tasted great gaine much authoritie began without cause suspect besideforth emulation grew among themselues shoulde thought worthier chosen three c sure enuied nothing trouble triall corruption shoulde called agayne ordinary court vse senate gentleman though agreed drusus said vvas nothing novv left deuided earth ayre among themselues yet conspired agaynste drusus people pleased wyth theyr newe habitation italian whose sake tribune hadde begunne thing could away placing newe habitacionsit seeme vvould haue reuoked certayne inl b tancies tus anes vmbrianes novv ato spoleto diuision common land ceasse rich men force fraude woulde winne streight get euill neyghbours would withholde tuscanes vmbrians hauing like affection brought consull inpretence dispatche drusus dede resist lawe againste openly cryed expected day determination tribune hearde came abroade gaue audience home darke gallerie euening dismissing people hapned cryed hurt word fell downe dead found yt stricke shomakers knife flanke thus drusus ye tribune drusus flayne slayne gentleman determination tooke occasion picke quarels enimies induced q valerius q valerius tribune take vppon accuse eyther priuily apertly furthered italian publique matter hoping thereby great men haue bin brought slaunders diffamation judge whych ridde away shoulde yet haue greater power common wealth whereas tribune refuse propound lawe gentleman sword hand co passe place caused law made soone obteyned brought accuser againste senatours whereof one bestius woulde obey wente voluntarie bestius exile himselfe cotta vvillingly exiled banishment would giue himselfe hand enimies cotta appeared iudgement hee boldly declared seruice common wealth reprehended gentleman shoulde cast decree wente away willingly mummius euercame greece promised gentleman released deceyued mummius exiled vvho ouers threvv cornelius thereof vvas called ac icu bycause stoode chose ende life found people rome vnthankefull linterno ye gulfe ionia send theyr embassador romaine complayning senate vsed seruice trauell alwayes getting theyr great empire made regard paine putte flighte sextus iulius kylied two thousande hys menne droue rni citie sextus iulius ouerthrovvne romayne deuotion standyng theyr defence l scipio l acilius slaues apparell fledde awaye enimies wyth tyme hunger consumed marius ignatius tooke venafro treason kylled two company venafro lost neere vultu perp ouerthrovvne discharged romaine p presenteius dyd ouerthrowe perpenna leader tenne thousande kylled foure thousande tooke armoure moste parte rest wherefore ratilius consull discharged perpenna hys leading commytted remnaunte armye c marius lamponius slewe eyghte hundred licinius crassus chased grument li crassus lost vvo e citie ar e naples citie grument c papius g nola treacherie made proclamation two thousande romaine come serue whyche dyd hee accepted captaynes refused obey hys proclamation hee tooke famished deathe wa e also castabuli minturnio salerno habitation castabuli campania mint campania vvhen mari hidde himselfe salerno beyonde naples nuceria be eged thirtie mile naples acerre citie campania vvhiche anniball burned people beeyng escaped oxintha sonne iugurth venusio apulia numidian rome caused prisoner captyues serue hys campe burned aboute compasse nuceria whyche caused nexte city yeelde feare hee requyryng armye sente hym tenne thousande menne one thousande horse wyth whyche hee beseeged acerre sextus caesar wyth tenne thousande frenche footemen manye numidian horsemenne approched acerre papius broughte venusio oxintha sonne iugurthe sometyme kyng numidia hee kepte romaine claddyng hym wyth purple shewed hym manye tymes numidianes wyth caesar whyche manye fledde thycke vnto hym theyr kyng wherefore caesar sente awaye rest suspected theyr countrey whiche papius came vppon hym wyth contempte bette downe parte hys trenche hee sente hys horsemenne aboute whyche kylled syxe thousande papius papius lose souldyoures whiche done caesar remoued campe acerre iudacilius iapigia canusians venusians manye cyties dyd yeelde woulde hee ouerc manye noble menne romaynes founde hee slewe common slaues hee vsed hys rutilius consull c marius made brydges farre asunder passe ouer riuer liris vetius cato camped nigh consull killed marius marius bridge perceyuing chance bodyes brought streame passed floud great speede set vppon catos camp kept made lodge nighte wonne day whence lacke victuall compelled depart pompedius deceyueth caepio two slaues pledge cladde purple sonnes haue credite broughte certayne wedge leade layde ouer siluer golde exhorted set vpon men without captayne easie ouerthrowen caepio light beliefe wente pompedius nigh place embushment ranne vp hill ospie enimie whome giuen token appeared ouerthrew caepio many moe caepio flay senate committed rest army marius sextus caesar sextus caesar fleeth marching thirtie thousand footemen fiue thousand horse among hilles rocky streyghtes marius ignatiue fell suddaynely vpon compassed fledde away litter bycause sicke riuer one bridge passe lost greater part armye threw away armoure whome hardly escaped theano armed agayne well could theano end apulia multitude came vnto hand ouer head approched acherre papio beseeged campes lay hard togither yet feare durst prouoke one cornelius sylla c marius followe valiantly marsians lay vnto hedge uineyardes marsians much adoe gote hedge whiche marius sylla thought good pursue sylla wayting camp side uineyards encountred would haue escaped killed manye slaughter day aboue sixe thousande harnesse romaine tooke great deale chaunce marsians like madde men fierce armed themselues againe went prouoke marsi valiant people latio novv campania romaine durst come hand begin fight nation warlike chance triumph made saying neyther triumph without falerio camepania vvhere good vvine praysed firmo tovvne march ancona mount ealerno iudacilius titus afranius p tidius togither ouerthrowe c pompeyus droue citie firmo wente way lefte afranius beseege pompey armed men speedely woulde come fighte yet comming army sente sulpitius backe afranius came forthe face fight doubtfull side sulpitius set enimies camp fire sawe fledde ascoli without order obedience afranius killed continuing afranius killed fight pompeyus proceeded winning ascoli indacilius borne ascoli fearing losse thereof heeiudacilius tooke eyght compantes went toward sending asculians soone saw farre yssue vppon enimies mighte assayled side would none notwithstanding iudacilius entred camp many could reprooued countreymen vnfaithfulnesse cowardlinesse hauingcrueltie iudacilius hope saue citie firste killed auntient enimies late caused multitude disobey instant done prepared fyre temple sette bedde vppon banquet hys friendes hadde made merrie dranke hys poyson layde hym downe strawe iudacilius death bade sette fyre thus iudacilius desyrous dye honourablie hys countrey made hys ende sextus caesar tyme hys office beyng expyred made uiceconsull senate sette vppon twentie thousande remoued theyr campe kylled eyghte thousande caesar dyeth vnarmed many lying long seege ascoli dyed disease appoynted c bebius serue place thing done italy aboute ionian sea hetrurians vmbrianes syde rome hearyng countreys theyr neyghboures disposed rebell senate beeing afrayde least enimie rounde aboute shoulde bee vndefended sente garrison free mace menne coast betweene citie cuma cuma campania felici freemade men sent vvarre firste tyme admytted serue warre wante free menne italian remayned good faith made free citie whyche desirous thys benefyte sente also hetrurianes receyued freedome verye friendelye hetrurians novv tuscanes senate thys curtesie made theyr welwyllers wyllyng putte oute doubte feare caused enimie hope lyke bee remisse romaine dyd receyue newe citizen fuye thirtie companyes manyethe italian made citizen rome least beeyng olde shoulde preuayle election broughte newe companyes deuided tennes whereby last election manye tymes theyr voyces vayne bycause olde fuye thirtie firste called halfe whether thys knowen firste italian contente wyth afterward cause newe contention aboute ienian sea hearyng hetrurianes repentaunce sente fifteene thousande menne ayde hetruria long laborious iourneys c pompeius nowe consull mette wyth kylled fyue thousande rest returnyng home waylesse place sharpe season wynter eatyng acornes halfe destroyed wynter cato pompeius fellowe made warre cato slayne vppon marsianes slayne sylla laye campe mount pompey l ignatius wyth greate despyghte encamped wythin halfe myle hym sylla coulde abyde thys sylla fleeth contumelie sette vppon hym tarrying hys forragiers dryuen flee hys forragiers come sette vppon hym agayne putte hym sylla putteth flight flyghte hee camped farther hauing supplye frenchman agayne placed hys campe neere sylla armyes beeyng thus nygh togither frenchman mightye stature came forthe alone challenged anye romaynesa combate numidian fyghte wyth hym little marusian aunswered hym kylled hym wyth whyche frenehmenne discouraged fledde theyr way whereby campe beeyng troubled companye cluentuis woulde tarrie wyth consusion fledde nola sylla pursued kylled thirtie thousande chase whereas nolanes receyued one gate feare enimie shoulde also enter slewe aboute walles twentye thousande among whome cluentius mansullye fyghting also cluentius slayne slayne sylla wente agaynste hirpinianes beseeged equilan hirpini rutians iucanes novv pasibcata looking lucanes ayde daye desired respite consider hee perceyuing theyr crafte gaue one houre meane tyme sette ladder walles whyche made woodde aquilano taken citie brut ende houre sette fyre beeyng afrayde yeelded yet spoyled bycause yeelded good necessitie yeelded receyued till subdued hirpian nation wente againste samnite way mut lu captaine kepte ouerthrovven vnknowen compasse came vppon suddainely killed many ranne hither thither mutilus hurt fledde asernia asernia sylla went brianes common counsell faction kept citie three fortress whyles brianes novve abruzzo brianes came wholly sylla sente aboute certayne whome willed take fortress coulde signifye smoke whiche done gaue hote assault front three houres togither gote towne thing sommer happily done sylla toward winter went rome stand consulship c pompeius salapia citie apulia vvhere vvas caught loue canue novve berletta canutui citie apulia vvhere best vvoll italy novv ca os floud anfido trebatius discomfited cossonius subdued marsians marusians venusians c cossonius lieutenant burne salapia tooke canue comming samnite whome fought valiantly till many dyed side fayne leaue seege canuti goe canue trebatius captayne samnite sente vnto cossonius eyther come ouer riuer deuided army fight goe backe might come wet backe trebatius comming ouer cossonius set vppon better fight woulde haue fledde ouer againe killed fifteene thousande trebatius men left fledde canusio cossonius hauing spoyled larinates c people apulia pediculi calabria landes larineans venutians asculans inuaded podiceans whome wanne two dayes cecilius metellus became successor army went iapigians ouerthrew battayle pompedius one popedius killed generalles reuolted people killed rest fled heapes caecilius sharpe contention italy called fellowes warre till receyued ciuilitie rome except lucanes samnite whyche italian receiued freedome rome seeme receyued also appointed seuerall company former least beyng ioyned olde number haue vpper hand election beganne usurer contende one othervsurie citie bycause bought debtes interest beyng forbidden take vsurie vpon vsuries olde law payne appoynted woulde vse vsuries seeme olde romaine detested vsurie muche romaine grecian persian hate vsurie greekes matter intollerable poore cause debate euill persian also like reason accompte full fraude leasing vsurie confirmed custome time required accordingly alleadged cause delay war sedition threatned vsurers statute asellio judge whome iurisdictionasellio belonged sought agree coulde wherefore gaue leaue trie controuersie lawe putting judge remembrance well custome law thing doubtfull usurer hearde asellius make mention olde law greeued kylled manner turne make oblation thesacrifice iupiters childre common place iupiters child multitude standing sacrifice one former threw stone hit wherefore flong downe vessell sacrifice ranne toward vesta goddesse virginitie temple vesta preuented excluded fledde shoppe slew many went thinking bin fledde among virgines rannedisorder place lawfull men come thus asellio judge sacrificing cladde holy vesture aselius killed golde solemnity wont killed second houre among temple miost common place senate made proclamation euer woulde bewray killer freema haue siluer bond shoulde haue freedome priuie shoulde haue pardon would usurer kept secrete murthers ciuill dissentions hapned yet afterward captaynes sedition great army contended togither law warre countrey stading pray could catch beginning proceeding whereof followes warre mithridates king pontus nation hadde inuaded bithinia ph gia asia confining samebeginning ciuill vvarres haue shewed booke matter lotte assigned sylla consull beeyng yet rome gouerne armye asia warre mithridates marius thoughte thys warre woulde easie dispatchmarius muche worth desirous also generalles roome attempted p sulpitius tribune people manye promise hys friende putte newe citizen italy good hope inferioure election distributed thorough company shewing hee wente aboute matter owne hee myghte vse faithfull minister assayes sulpitius straightwaysulpitius propounded law taken place marius sulpitius haue willes bycause new citizen farre exceede olde thing auntients perceiuing stoutely resist new side vsed stone staues defence euill growing still greater consul fearing passing law proclayme vacation many dayes festiuall tymesvacation wont done intermission mighte hadde lawe inconuenience sulpitius coulde abyde thys vacation therefore willed hys faction come common place weapon hidde fall sparing consul neede thys done spake agaynste vacation thing contrarye lawe bad consulles sulpitius vacation sylla q pompey forthwyth reuoke mighte proceede approbation lawe tumulte began beeyng prepared drewe dagger threatned kyll consulles spake agaynste wherefore pompey secretely fledde sylla went asyde take aduice pompey sonne beeyng sonne lawe sylla kylled sulpitius faction bycause hee spake somewhat liberally agaynste sylla returned reuoked vacation wentevacation reuoked capua army passe asia war mithridates knowing thing yet meante agaynste hym vacation beeyng dissolued sylla gone capua chiefe citie campania vvarre mithridates appoynted marius sylla hys souldyers citie sulpitius propounded lawe c marius whome done assigned rule warre agaynste mithridates sylla hys place sylla hearing determining trye fight called hys souldyoures togyther whyche desirous goe thys iourney gayne thereof knewe marius woulde vse souldyoures declared vnto spyghte sulpitius marius hadde done hym shewyng playnely hys meaning hee durst yet make mention suche warre exhorted bee readye occasion shoulde requyre vnderstanding hys intente afrayde preuented thys warfare opened syllas cogitation badde hym boldly leade sylla ur e rome armes rome hee beyng gladde thereof marched wyth syxe legion officer hys campe one tresourer posted rome coulde abyde goe agaynste theyrofficers good coscience countrey embassadoures came hym way asked hym wyth armes hee dyd inuade hys countrey aunsweredaunsvvere sylla delyuer tyrauntes hee made thys aunswere twice thrice seuerall embassador wythall required senate wyth marius sulpitius myghte meete hym flelde mar hee woulde doe counsell seeme good hee come nygh pompeyus hys fellowe resorted hym allowing praysing hys doyngs ioynyng wyth hym thynges marius sulpitius prepared shorte distaunce sente embassadoures directed senate wyllyng hym come nygher fyue myles citie tyll hadde consulted presente state sylla pompey well vnderstandyng theyr meaning promised doe yet followed soone gone sylla tooke gate called celimontana wall nexte one legion pompey celimontana gate collina gate tooke collina gate wyth thyrde hee placed bridge wodde fourth left warde vnder walles rest entred citie enunies mind deede wherefore dweller aboute stoppe castyng entreth citie vvith armes vpon aboue threatned burne house ceassed marius sulpitius came afs lie vvas hill rome vppon vvhich llus host u kept souldioures first fight armes rome boldnesse syl playne esquily manye suddayne coulde bring armed first fight euer rome suche enimies nowe anye pretence dissention playne force trumpet ensignes lawe warre inconueniences come nourishing dissentious sylla hys souldyoures gaue backe wherefore tooke standerd stoode daunger reuerenc generall feare dishonor come forsake ensigne stay straighte fleeyng sylla called freshe souldyers campe without sente others saburra old vvriting succurra streete rome vvhere souldyers vvere placed releeue esquilia streete called saburra compasse enimies backehalfe marius company made faint resistace new men fearing compassed euery side called citizen fought yet house proclaymed libertie seruauntes would come help none comming forthe vtter despayre fledde citie euery noble man faction sylla passed marius fleeth way called holy made spoyle punished holy vvay rome named peace romulus made vvith sight men also set garrison citie pompey watched going aboute euery hurt done eyther lost wonne day come called people counsel lamented state betrayed certayne troublesome men constreyned necessitie doe done thoy affirmed nothing importance propounded people debated senate renuing auntient lawe nowe sylla renueth olde lavves comicia ceturiata vvhere best men gaue voyces king tullus long time vse election shoulde ordinarie company wardes generall assemblie rate substance according institution kyng tullus supposing two thing lawe propounded people senate electios con st poore bolde sorte steede wise substantiall men shoulde suche occasion sedition many thing spake tribune writing againste power tyrannicall whereby senate growen contempt vnfyt men therefore chose togither three hundred vest sorte whatsoeuer bin done sulpitius vacation consul reuoked vnlawfull thus sedition strife contention dyd growe murther murthers warre thys first army citizen inuaded countrey enimies yet sedition ceassed trial armes continuall inuasions made rome walles beaten downe extremity warre done reuerence eyther lawe common wealthe countrey able refrayne violent mindes banished sulpitius marius c proclaymed traytors tribune marius sixe time consul sonne p cethegus umus brutus c q granius p albinouanus lectorius number twelue senator stirrer tumult rebellious consul prouokers slaues reuolt offering libertie whiche proclaymed enimies romaine state lawfull kil without punishment bring th consul goodes confiscate serchers ranne aboute catch founde sulpitius slew marius alone without sulpitius slayne seruant fellow fledde minturna ruler citie feare proclamation keeping close house mynturna campania betvvene formiae sinness marius fleeth minturna hadde bin sixe time consull done many notable feates would authours death sente frenchman chance sword kill frenchman say wente lying strawe darkea frenchman appointed marius house afrayde thoughte eye dyd cast forthe beames flame fire rise hys couch cryed loude voyce darest thou kil c marius frenchman fledde fast could house like marius escapeth madde man cry kyl marius whereby ruler doubtfully hadde determined stricken diuine feare fame spoken childhoode man shoulde seauen time consull say childe seuen yong eagle fell lappe whiche southsayerstoken marius honor shewe shoulde seauen time haue greatest honor magistrate minturna remembring thinking frenchman feared god operation conueyd marius citie saue himselfe well could knowing sought sylla followed horseman went toward sea vnbeate wayes chansing vpon cotage stayed couered hys body leaues hearde noyse lay still couered wyth hys leaues hearing lept old fisherman bote tooke away spight teeth tempest arosehard happe marius escaping cutte cable hoysted saile committed himselfe fortune came iland founde shippe friendes whome sayled lybia beeing reiected thence sextus presidente enimie liued winter sea vnder mountaynes numidia thus againe seaborde knowen hys friend sayled c egus granius alben uanus lectorius others sonne whiche valiant men fledde rome numidian prince afrayde treason departed thence good set vpon sylla whome thought violently vse countrey lacking army tarried till occasion might serue sylla beeyng first euer entred citie armes able haue made himselfe rome equall monarch enged enimie willingly refrayne violece sent army capua ruled agayne consull faction banished chiefly riche menne woman full money deliuered feare army earnest returne men omitted neyther care cost laying wayte consulles bodyes bycause well matter dashed nowe sylla shoulde eaue office army appoynted mithridates defence pompey consull people pitying case appoynted gouernemente italy army vnder c pompeius cneus heard tooke euill yet receyued quintus campe pompey consull killed next day office cneus wente aside priuate man till number pretending heare consull enclosed killed fleeing away cneus returned though bin maruellous angry consul vnlawfully slayne angry straight tooke rule vppon agayne newes consul deathe brought citie sylla afrayd himselfe strayght carried friendes wheresoeuer wente night also tarrying log went capua army fro thence sayled asia frieds fledde men great confidence cinna consulc sylla stirred new citizen deuises marius thought meete shoulde mixt olde company least last roomes shoulde lost plat marius friend returne olde citizen stoode stiffely cinna stoode newe citizen corrupted thought three hundred talentes octauius consull defended olde cinna companieoctauius closely armed tooke comon place cryed mixed copanies inultitude better minded resorted octauius weapon also whome tarrying home take aduisement w e brought part tribune resist doings tumult new citizes weapon drawne way againste tribune contrary side rushing comon place octanius heard wet way called holy great copany vvay holy throging middest cotrary side gote comonplace stayed whe thus afraide went teple iupiters childre auoide cinna himtu vvhich nev citizen killed without commaundement ranne vppon newe citizen killed manye chaced fleeyng gate cinna hauyng hys trust newe citizen page duplicate page duplicate thinking haue done force contrarie opinion seeing boldnesse haue ouercome went aboute citie called slaues libertie none came ranne nexte city whiche long made free rome ibur preneste farre ur novve sixteene mile rome preneste novve p lastr champa ne rome nola nine mile naples cinna deposed nola stirred sedition gathered money warre cinna thus occupyed deuising senator minde fledde vnto c melonius quintus sertorius c marius senate decree cinna taken consull citizen bycause consull left citie tumulte called bondman libertie place appoynted lucius merula iupiters prieste saye holye prieste mighte euer weare thethe thing vvas called apex vvhich vvas vvand vvound vvith vvooll heigth hatte iupiters priest c souldiers wand hatte alway might sacrifice cinna went capua armye romaine make sute ruler many senator went middest consull threwe away mace like priuate man wepte sayde citizen receyued dignitie people gaue senate haue taken without suffer mine owne cause greeued sake desire fauoure company election neede haue shal longer lord election assembly chiefe officer mainteyne haue giuen take away see cause spoken thus stirre lamenting muche owne cause rente garment ranne chaire fell flatte among still lay downe till pity sake tooke vp set againe chaire tooke bundelles authoritie cinna restored dignitie bade hope well became consull vse occasion require officer campe meane relent sware cinna oth souldiour rest done wente boldly confederate city stirred whose sake suffered calamitie releeued money many great men citie came vnto whiche like quiet state common wealth thus cinna octauius merula consul fortifyed citie rampiers preparationthe con prepare defence engine warre sente souldyers city remayned obediente fraunce next neyghboure also called home cneus pompeius proconsull leading armye coast ionian sea come speede serue hys countrey dyd planted collina gate rome novve salaria hys host gate called collina cinna came also encamped caius marius hearing thys passed sea hetruria marius returneth fellowes banished seruauntes came aboute fyue hundred hys friendes rome vile apparell long heare moue pitie wente city shewing victory honoures agaynste germanes andthe germanes vvere caled cimbrianes novv thought e hys syxe tymes consulshippe whyche pleased best promised doe lawe election hee gathered syxe thousande toscanes came wyth cinna gladly receyued hym societie doyngs ostia spoyled mouth tiber tvvelue mile rome arimino part novv called romania next omberdie vvas diuision de italy floud rubicon cee lius metellus precise giueth occasion aduantage enimie marius entreth rome appius claudius eceyueth marius citie beyng mette togyther ordered theyr army floude tiber deuided three partes cinna carbo ouer agaynste citie sertorius aboue marius towarde sea made bridge ouer riuer myghte keepe victual citie marius tooke ostia spoyled cinna sente take arimeno army shoulde come nyghe fraunce consul afrayde hauyng neede army bycause coulde call home sylla beeyng entred asia commaunded cecilius metellus aboute remnaunt fellowes warre againste samnite shoulde dispatche honestly coulde come helpe hys countrey inuaded stoode muche vpon termes wyth samnite whyche marius hearde graunted theyr demaundes samnite ioyned marius appius claudius captayne keeper hyll ianiculo walles hauing receyued good turne myndfull benefyte opened gate breake day marius entred cinna followed soone repulsed octauius pompey came agaynste marius repulsed chaunced greate lyghtnings pompey destroyed lightning fell vpon pompey armye whereby manye noble menne destroyed marius kepte victual citie came sea aboue freshe water hee rode nigh city anye corne layde antium novv aritia tenn mile rome lanuuis novv indouina marius keepeth victual rome vvay called appia vvent porta capena br dase paued vvith fouresquare stone mount albano nigh rome vvith lake vvhich propliecie vvent unes victorie romayne store suddayne comming antio aritia lanuuio hee tooke city treason thus keeping awaye victual lande also hee approched towarde rome boldly way called appia victualles coulde bee broughte anye place wyth cinna carbo sertorius camped twelue myles rome octauius crassus metellus dyd lye agaynste mount albano considering tyme come although superioure strength number yet hadde compassion putte theyr countrey hazarde one battayle cinna sente trumpettes aboute citie proclayming libertie seruauntes whereby multitude fugitiues came vnto hym senate afrayde thereby doubtyng people bycause want thyngs citie chaunged theyr mynde sente embassadoures cinna reconciliation hee asked firste whether came hym consull priuate person doubted answere returned rome nowe many freeman came vnto faction feare famine see sequeale andresort nowe proudely approched walles camped within arrowe shotte octauius feare doubte slowe fighte bycause runnawayes ofte sendyng betweene senate greately amazed thoughte vniust depose lucius merula iupiters prieste chosen cinnas place hadde offended beeyng oppressed wyth greate myseries sente cinna consull looked greatethe senate sendeth cinna consull doubriull aunsvvere good thereby requyred cinna sweare hee woulde commytte murther hee resused sweare promised willinglye hee woulde bee cause manslaughter hee wylled also octauius came gate shoulde gette hym away least displeasure mighte done hym agaynste hys wyll thys aunswered hygh throne consull embassadoures citie marius marius standyng nexte senate silente hys cruell countenaunce perceyued bente murther senate accepted thys willed cinna marius enter well knowyng marius dyd cinna assented marius spake iestyng wyse marius scorne lawfull banished manne enter wherefore tribune dyd reuoke banishmente dissolue decreethe banishment marius reuoked marius cinna giue oth octauius counselled flee made againste hym sylla entred citie wyth feare receyued made spoyle contrarye parte wythoute stoppe cinna marius sente theyr othes octauius southsayers diuiners badde hym trust hys friendes counselled hym flee hee protesting neuer leaue citie whyles heethe constancie octauius consull wente among ianiculo noble men parte armye hee remayned sate downe seate cladde robe rule wayted vpon wyth roddes ax consulles wont censorinus censorinus commet kill octauius contrary oth came agaynste hym certayne horsemenne hys friendes perswadyng hym flee hys armye bringing hym horse woulde allowe ryse abode deathe censorinus cutte hys heade octauius consull headed broughte cinna fyrste consulles head sette vppe common place head slayne set vp also mischiefe beginning octauius continued still murthers counted enimies searcher ranne straighte aboute fynde foe regarde senator gentleman difference made head senator put vp common place neyther reuerence god respect men anye matter made murther bent cruell actes actes horible fightes killing crueltie cuttyng head kylled feare astonishmet beholder making thereof miserable shewe c lucius iulius breethren atilius eranius p lentulus g numitorius bebius werenoble men killed crassus killed slayne beeyng mette way crassus fledde wyth sonne preuented killing himselfe killed pursuer marcus antonius orator fledde forme antonius orator bevvrayd vintner house keeper whereof receyued gentlye hydde hym sendyng seruaunte wyne tauerne oftner hee wonte tauerner asked hym hee boughte wyne ofte tolde hym secretely eare vintner sente one straighte marius opened matter whereof hee glad mynded haue gone marius glad haue antonius killed kylled hym hymselfe beeyng stayed friendes captayne bande appoynted sente hys souldyoures house whome antonius beeyng singulare orator dyd deteyne wyth sweete speech dyuers wayes mouyngeloquence pitie captayne maruellyng matter wente house founde attentiuely hearkenyng hys tale wherefore hymselfe kylled hym yet eloquente speakyng sente hys head marius cornutus lying hydde cotage hys menne carefullye kepte cornutus saued seruauntes hym founde dead bodye whyche threwe fyre hadde made searcher came sayde theyr maisters bodye whome hadde fyrste strangled thus hee saued hys seruauntes q ancharius wayted marius shoulde make sacrifice capitoll trustyng tyme sacrifice fynde hym mercifull hadde begunne sacrifice sawe ancharius commyng vnto commaunded hym killed hys head antonius ancharius killed temple consulles senatours sette vp common place none theyr body thus slayne thoughte worthye bee buried carcass many noble men throwne downe deuoured dogges foule many horrible actes done vpon expulsion possession publication goodes depriuatio dignity reuocation thing sylla done whose friend kinsfolke killed house pulled downe good conflscate proclaymed enemie countrie wife sylla proclaymed rebell daughter great daunger escayed finally sortes mi erie mischiefe could inuented shewe law authoritie many murder without law accusings broughte againste merula iupiters priestaccusers merula anger office whiche tooke without displeasure cinna catulus luctatius felow marius catulus luctatius warre agaynst gimbrians saued marius thought vnthankfull sore agaynst banished kept close pryson till court day called iudgement must foure time cited certen distaunce houres merula meane time cut hys vaynes wryting made testifie layde priestly attyre cut merula dieth vaynes lawfull priest die vpon catulus choked chamber new made moysty catulus dieth smoke thus two died bondman came cinna proclamation al made free seruyng soldiours onely runne aboute spoyle euery house also slew whome soeuer mette sparyng olde maysters cinna many time monishe cinna killeth free made neuer better wherefore night rest sent ye french bandes killed euery one thus flaues receyued worthy punishment theyr vnfaithfulnesse agaynst maysters yeare folowyng cinna seconde tyme marius vij tyme chosen consul banishment proclamation man might kill token seuen egles appeared agayne vnto bent extremitie agaynst sylla died firste ikoneth marius dyeth seueth cosulship cinna tooke valerius flaccus hys place sente asia beyng dead also chose carbo marius place dyeth asia felow office sylla thynkyng long returne agaynst hys enimies made shorte ende mithridates wee haue sayde inactes sylla asia three yeares complete destroyed one hundred threescore thousande menne restored romaine empyre graecia macedonia asia ionia nation mithridates oppressed hee tooke hym hys nauie shutte hym within compasse father kyngdome hee returned arinie mightie obedient experte coragi u theyr doyngs paste brought also multitude shippes money furniture thyngs fitte whereby hee feared hys enimies cinna carbo beyng perplexed sente diuerse ouer ital prouide money menne victuall ryche menu theyr substaunce made sure citties styrred especially newe made citizen whose sake daunger prepared nauy great speede called home shippes cicelie kepte coaste sure omitted nothing might done speedy care diligence sylla haughty harte wrote senate himselfe shewyng hee done lybia treasourer agaynst iugurth kyng numidia agaynst cimbrians cicelie admirall felowes warre consull late affayres done agaynst mithridates chiefly extolled rehearsing large infinite sorte nation taken hym made subiecte romaynes notwithstandyng sylla vvrighteth senate whiche bycause hee receyued certayne afficted gentleman rome banished cinna comforted calamitie hee hys enimies proclaymed rebell hys countrey hys house pulled downe hys friendes slayne wyfe chyldren coulde scarcely saue themselues flee vnto hym nowe woulde come au nged whole cittie theyr doyngs citizen newe made woulde blame letter redde euery man afrayd sent embassadours treate attenement aduersaries requyred assuraunce senate woulde fulfill commaunded cinnas officer leaue gathering till syllas aunswere heard promised embassador gone made themselues consul nexte yeare bycause woulde returne suddayne election wente aboute italy gathering men whiche sente lyburnia ready intending sette vpon sylla firste wente dalmatis novv part slauonia prosperous iourney nexte beaten tempest came lande returned euery man theyr countrey though woulde willingly serue agaynstethe souldyers refused goe countreymen citizen hearing thys refused sayle lyburnia cinna displeased warned assemble mynding compell anger wente thynking reuenged one sergeantes makyng way cinna hitting one souldyers ouer legges army stroke sergeant agayne cinna commaunding taken made great shoute fell throwing stone next drew swordes kylled thus cinna consul murthered carbo called fro cinna killed carbo afrayde goe rome lyburnia yt sayled thither afraid doings woulde returne rome albeit tribune earnestly require come election new fellow office legth threatning would make priuate came propounded ye electio new consul day vnlucky hee appointed daye also lightning falling vpon temple mone goddesse corne maisters ceremonieslightnings vpon teple moone cere differre election till standing high ye sommer sunne carbo cosul alone meane tune sylla made answere came fro senate thatthe aunsvvere sylla could friend dealte outragiously citie desired preseruation quarrell yet said sure would trust whome defend welwilling armye thys wo de chiefly vnderstanded woulde dissolue army intended play tyrante requyred hys dignitie hys substance priesthode anye office restored vnto without exception embassadoures sente certayne require whiche hearing cinna slayne citie troubled returned brunduse sylla nothing sylla fiue legiones italyans syxe thousand horse certaine pelop neso macedonia marched hauing whole pelop neso novv pireo vvas porte athens novv porto ne para achaia sylla giueth priuileges brunduse fortie thousande pireo patra patra brunduse xvj hundreth shippes brundusianes receyued willingly wherfore gaue priuiledges yet holde thence remoued army went forward mesellus surnamed duetifull lefte finishe fellowes warre cinna marius came citie remayned liguria see would happe came vnto ncalled fellow warre accepted societie yet metellus duetifull c uneth sylla procon ull chosen continue till returne rome metellus c pompeius long pompeius com ieth called greate sonne killed lightnyng sayde came vnto legion picenes glory father mighte doe muche people auoyde suspition thought syllas friende shortly brought twoo legion moste forwarde man auncement sylla wherfore pompey honored sylla sylla greate honour say would onely rise came though yong warre ceasing sente lybia breake carbos friendes restore hiempsall whome numidian expulsed hiempsall restored pompey whiche sylla graunted triumph numidian beyng yet yong gentleman meane pompey growyng greate sente spayne agaynste sertorius p ntus agaynst methridates cethegus also came sylla earnest enimie cinna marius put citie humbled himselfe vnto promised seruice woulde haue hym thus hauing greate army many noble friendes hee vsed lieutenant metellus yet proconsul highest place thought sylla proconsul warre mithridates yet discharged though iudged rebell marius ha e bare enimies greeuous close citie well coniecturing nature last inuasion thereof hauing taking yet eye decree made still memorie house ouerthrowe sight goodes con cated friend killed familiethe preparation syllas enemy hardly escaped maruellous feare thinking meane betweene victorie vtter destruction feare conspire consul sente aboute italy gathered men money leauing nothing thys extremitie eyther fore ight diligence caius norbanus lucius c norbanus l scipio carbo scipio consul carbo yeare authoritie hauing like hate againste sylla feare conscience yt done gathered citie great army could italy went seuerally againste sylla two hundredthe consuss sylla tvventy thousand men band fiftie men firste fauor men enclyned towarde consul doings sylla comming againste countrey shewe enimie consul friend dyd pretence sylla seemeth enimie countrey consul cary authoritie state common sorte knowing former offence ioyned partaker dread perceiued certainly sylla minde correction afraying punishment fewe destruction slaughter vtter vndoing generally whiche opinion vayne warre consumed tenne thousand twe tie thousand many time fall one fight citie fiftie thousande side slayne rest sylla lefte kinde crueltie vndone neyther priuate men whole city till made himselfe monarke romaine empire brought pleasure inspiration shewed vnto fearefull thing againste reason vexe men priuately publikely ouer italy olde prophestes fearefullprophecies called memorie menye monster dayly seene le bring forthe woman deliuered uiper amonstrons token child god earthquake shaked citie ouerthrewe many temple greeued ye romaine capitollcapitoll turned king continued foure hundred yeares sette fyre man coulde tell cause foreshew multitude men killed ouerthrowe italy captiuitie rome hir citizen change common wealth warre beganne sylla arriued brunduse clxxiiii olympiad length itthe sharpnesse vvarre great sharpnesse extremity euerye man priuate meanes followed bycause vehemencie affection caused short time sharper effect followe three yeares continued italy till sylla gote thethree yeares lasted vvarre principalitie spayne continued longer battayles skirmish expugation fortes seeges formes warres italy whole army part seuerall captaynes many al notable greatest worthy whiche speake brieflie first canutium proconsul againstthe battayle ca sio place called c vvhere l gaue romaine great ouerthrovve another name ca ssa th ap norbanum norbanus lost vj men sylla lxx many moe wounded norbanus fledde capua sylla metellus theano lucius scipio came armye verye faintly desired peace might made wyth sylla sent scipio agree vpon article much hoping good bycause thought army woulde rather reuolt reason discouragemet yet met scipio tooke hostage agreemets went came field three eyther side conferre knowen dyd scipio thought good send sertorius norbanus felow signifie spoken army remaining quiet loking answere sertorius iourney tooke swessa towne ssa taken time treatie sertorius citie campania nigh mon massico syllas sylla sent messenger complaine scipio either priuie fact doubting answere thing fitte sertorius sent hostage againe sylla army offended deede sertorius time treaty sending againe ye hostage required layde al blame scipio con ull betrayd army vpon consul priuily copacted reuolt sylla would draw neere al wet vnto leauing scipio consull lucius sonne tente taken sylla thinke strange thing farre vnfitte captayne ignorat practise whole army whe sylla could persuade scipio let sonne goe without hurte sent norbanus treate condition eyther bycause afraid ye force italy conspired consul went deceiue done scipio man coming answer bycause seemeth norbanus feared like blame army sylla marched toward wasting al thing enimie norbanus like toke wayes carbo made hast citie proclaimed metellus gone sylla rebel time ye capitoll fire iupiters temple capitoll fire say carboes worke consul say sylla sente certetie vnknowen could neuer learne way came sertorius chose pretor iberia sertorius fleeth spayno deteined swess fled prouince former prefors receiuing caused romaine haue much army consul encreased euery day fro part italy hither side france aboute eridanus riuerriuer po sylla idle sente euery place italy gote many loue feare money hope thus rest sommer consumed yeare folowing paptrius carbo agayne marius nephew aesis novve fiemesino betvveene spoleto ancons fight betvvene metellus carinna mighty marius xxvij yeares old chosen consul winter cold continuing long deuide asunder beginning spring floud aesis fro morning tyl midday greate battaile fought betwixt metellus carinna one carbos pretor carinna losing manye fled away ye countrey yeelded metellus forse ke consul carbo came vpo metellus beseged til heard marius consull great ouerthrow preneste remoued cap toward arimino rereward wherof set neste farre rome novv roman se farre battayle betvveene sylla yong marius pompeius greately distressed sylla tooke sett marius lodged nigh withdrew little little til come place called holy port set order gaue sylla battel fought fearcely til left wing began giue backe fiue bad footemen two horseme loking turne threw downe ensignes fled sylla cause marius ruine many slayne rest fled preneste sylla followed chace prenestines receyue yt came first whenpart yong marius souldiers reuolt sylla sa ites killed saw sylla hand shut gate tooke marius rope ye walles al slayne taken wherof many samnite sylla comanded killed antient enimies romaine time also residue carbes army ouercome metellus fiue band while fought reuolting vnto pompeius ouerthrewe marcius sena sacked sena citie tuscane hundreth mile side rome citie sylla hauing marius shut preneste made trech citie great wall good way appointing lucretius offella charge otherwise meaning deale marius famine marius loking help would needes kill priuate enimies sent brutus pretor citie assemble another purpose kil pub ant stius papirius crueltie yong marius agai citizen p anti pap carbo domitius sccuol slayne carbo lucius domitius lucius sceuola great bishop romaine two slayne cousell marius commanded domitius fleeing stricke going sceuola slaine little ye senate house body cast ye riuer vse burie killed sylla sent army seuerally diuers wayes rome willed take gate citie repulsed retyre ostia city receiued came great feare opened gate whe would come whe came citie selfe opened gate pined wyth hunger oppressed desperation presente euils vre suffer mightier power whiche sylla hee knew came forward camp planted fielde sylla entreth rome mar gate entred contrarye faction fleeing citie goodes made common caused sold trumpet called people counsell lamenting present time badde good cheere sylla people woulde set quiet bring common wealthe better estate whatsoeuer ordeyne clusio vnder dominion sena vvhere porsena king tuscane helde court spanish horseman clani clanius farre fro naples citie acerra best hauing thus disposed matter leauing certayne friend garde citie rauenna shippe winne region vritanes abundante grasse corne certayne syllas people entring naples treason nighte slewe sauing fledde tooke away gallies citie betweene carbo sylla sore fight clusium till sunne wente downe fought like courage side nighte ende fight field spoleto pompeius crassas lieutenant sylla kil three thousand carbos souldiers beseeged carinna camped ouer carbo minded releeue carinna host sylla vnderstanding placed embushment passing destroyed two thousand carinna darke nighte full rayne shower although enimies perceyued cared foule tempest fiedde away carbo vnderstanding marius fellowe distressed hunger preneste commaunded martius goe thither eyght legion agaynste whome pompeius lying awayte straighte put iourney hauing killed many held beseeged vpon hill vppon martius without companion fiers still kept fledde away army laying blame deceyte vpon fell diuision one whole legion vnderthe olte li martius ensignes without anye commaundement marched ariminum wente euery man countrey remayned seauen bandes capsayne martius infelicitie came carbo marcus lamponius lucania lamponius pom telisius gutta capu mu come relceue marius pontius tilisius samnite capuanus sillas faction without respect oth seemed fulfilled hys promise keeping office purpose secreate senate sent lepidus maketh vvarre ignorant called came al hys army though would haue entred rome therewith beyng forbidden proclaymed warre trumpet catulus side like long making aa battel betvvene consul lepidus ouercome dyeth sardinia sea libya called sanda liotis bycause like ole foote sertorius battel field mar lepidus ouercome without great chace fled sardinia beeyng vexed wyth consuming disease dyed hys armye disturbed sundry partes dissolued greatest part perpenna led spaine sertorius laste worke left sylla thys warre sertorius continuyng eyght yeares difficultie romaine agaynste spaniardes one another againste sertorius ruled sertorius occasio nevv vvarre iberia carbo sylla warre tooke citie suessa composition haue said fled thence office leading wyth hym armye italian gathered celtiberians wyth whome hee expulsed officer sylla woulde admit hym fought valiantly metellus sent hym sylla couragious anye feate elected senate three hundred present friend called romaine sertorius maketh senate spayne senate dispight whereof hee named choice counsell sylla dead hym lepidus sertorius hauing another army italian perpenna brought vnto pretor ofperpenna lepidus opinion able make warre vppon italy senate fearing sente another armye another pretor whiche pompey army iberia pompey spayne yong gentleman renowmed seruice done vnder sylla libya italy passed alpes boldly way anniball notablye rodanus rosne fraunce eridanus poo italy brake another way fountaines rodanus eridanus whiche floudes haue theyr spring far asunder high alpes rodanus runneth frenchemen beyond alpes tirr ne sea within alpes flowing ionia steede eridanus called padus come iberia sertorius straight ouerthrowe one legion goyng foraging baggage slaues citie iustice vv lau one pompeius sighte spoiled ouerthrew siege woman missused souldior courage beyonde nature hir kinde pulled hys eies sertorius vvhole bande put deathe hauing vnderstanding chaunce putte death whole bad counted corrupted like thing though al romaine winter comming rested spring pirenei mountaines diuide spaine fro irace lusitania portugall battel sura novve sucrone approching came forth metellus pompey fro mount pirinei sertorius perpenna lusitania met citie called sura giuing battell though horrible thunder clere aire maruellous lightning reason flash vpon yet expert souldiors without fear kept fight made great murder one another til metellus metellus ouerthrovveth perpenna sertorius ouercometh metellus pompey remoued fro wintrings mount pirenei iberia sertorius perpenna came fro lu itania time many fled fro sertorius metellus sertorius grieued hadled many sertorius remoueth romains guard person sertorius cruell cruelly barbarously wherby grew hate army rather yt remoued romains fro custody hys body put celtiberians place could abide reproued vnfaithfulnesse though serued ennimy rome thing chiefly grieued countedgriefe romains rebel coutry sake yet suspected ther difference betwene fugitiue faithful celtiberians also vsed dispitefully taunted vnfaithful notwithstading romains vtterly forsake himaragon bycause commodity valiat fortunate captaine hee somuche celtiberians woulde call hym anniball hys promptnesse moste politicke forwarde capitayne coulde rehearse sertorius compared anniball sort stoode army sertorius metellus people daily molest city copell many yeelde vnto pompeius besieged palantia wyth tymber made waye scale wall sertorius came reliefe remoued siege pompey burned hys timber worke destroyed walles retyred metellus sertorius repaired citie speedilye wet toward calagyrus encoutring yt lay killed ye doings iberia yere yere following romaine capitaines greater courage set vpo city yt held sertorius tooke sought get pollicie vsing theyr whole force euery attept ye yere folowing came stronger field thing confidece nowe sertorius sertorius decayeth began decay god hym hee omitting law trauailes captain gaue himselfe delicatenesse wome feasting drinking cause many time ouercome falling fury rage euery trifle suspected euery man wherefore perpena faction aemilius perpe conspiracie came vnto wt gret army bega doubt conspired wyth tenne beeyng discouered hanged escaped perpenna beeyng named maruellous good hap perseuered rather hysdeath sertorius purpose desired sertorius banquet although neuer wente withoute hys guarde yet seaste little respect hee ouerladen wine perpenna cut heade place feasted armye wyth great ire tumulte rose againste perpenna chaunging theyr hate loue capitaine though hadde u greate lykyng hym hee deade remembraunce vertue tourned mindes pitie thys presentmiserie causeth pitie case contemned perpenna priuate man thinking weale consist sertorius could abideportugales perpenna lusitanes barbarian thought much whome sertorius chiefly vsed warre table testament vnsealed perpenna founde heyre euerye man hated hym bicause hee onely traytour hys capitayne hys friende benefactour hadde helde theyr handes perpenna hydde hymselfe pleased perpenna founde heyre sertorius gift promise made afrayde feare sharpely vsed terror common sorte humbled himselfe suche pryson sertorius deliuered lusitanes restored pledge perpenna cruel wherfore content take captain honor sertorius yet without great difficultie cruell soone fel sharpe punishing romaine came hym killed three noblest sorte hys nephew metellus gone side iberia thinkyng pompey sufficient ouerthrowe perpenna spent tyme makyng skirmish bringing thefight betvvene pompey perpenna whole power tenth day battailes came field thinking one worke make end pompey passed little perpennas experience perpenna distrustfull army cotinuance obedience rather willing try pompey giuing onset ercely perpenna ouerthrovv perpenna abiding captain army voide goodwil soone ouercome euery man flying perpenna hid vnder tuffte bush fearing enimies beeing taken certaine horseman dragged pompey owne people hee euil spoken offence againste sertorius made great ado brought aliue pompey reueale vnto gret matter romaine factio eyther tel thedeath perpenna truth saue himselfe pompey sent haue hym kylled came sight fearing leaste hee might haue vttered strange matter might haue bin beginning new stirvvisedome pompey rome wherin pompey seemed well wisely wan great opinion therby end war iberia sertorius life bin dead would haue bin finished neyther soone easyly warre spartaco time italy swordplayer kepte capua forspartacus shews called spartacus thracian borne serued war wyth romaine slaue custodie shew cu ning play persuaded lxx fellow adueture libertie rather tha slaues shews forcing keeper ran away arming hemet stauesmount de soma swordes fled mount vesuuius whither many slaues freeman flying fro country receiued aenomaus crissus robbed plaines adioyning appointed two officer aenomaus crissus two swordplayers making equall diuision varinius glaber p valerius vvere ouercome spartacus pray among short tyme great multitude came vnto hym ouercome varinius glabrius first sent hym publius valerius wt army regard hast could gather way romaine think shold need looked effect afirste battel betvvene spartacus romaine swordplayers hand came battell romaine ouercome spartacus killed varinius horse lacked little romaine captain take vile sword player fight resorted spartacus army lxx made armor al prouision romaine sent consul twoo legion mount gargano appulia novve called mount angelo whome crissus came wyth xxx ouercome mount garinus loosing two partes army life also spartacus passed ouer mount apennine go france beyond alpes one consul laye waye spartacus ouercometh consul stopped passage followed fought ouercame seuerall fightes co suls retyred tumuit spartacus sacrifice three hundered romaine felowe cressus twentie thousand remainesacrifice footemen wente rome burning vnprofitable birdes killed captiues beastes cariage march faster many fugitiues comming vnto would admitte none consul encoutred picene notable fight many romaine slayne loste day yet durst go directly rome bycause thinke hymselfe equai citizen feates warre army throughly instructed neuer citie toke part slaues fugitiues confused multitude folowing th r apulia vvhich romaine made colonie called copia turned mountaines thurus besieged towne hee forhad merchat bring gold siluer campe vsed brasse yron admitted paying wel hurt brought wherby hauing matter abeudant hee made verye fayre armour vsed seeke pray countrey fought romaine againe victorie went away great spoyle three yeares pastthree yeares vvarre warre remayned horrible romaine first contemned play fence election new consul come terror desired office till licinius crassus notable rome house andzicin u crassus rich toke vpon sixe legion wente spartacus come nigh receyued army crassus doth execution two cosuls put death euery tenth bapt lot bycause bin oft ouercome thinke crassus ouercom c otherwise al fought ouercome punished tenth kylled foure thousande hauing doubt multitude whither euer dyd auayled much ouerthrow enemy set vpo ten thousand spartacus men camped wherof killed two partes like courage fiercely encoutryng spartacus ouercame notable fightthe thu ttel spartacus yet tovvard chased sea wher thought escape ship sicilie ouertoke enclosed trench forced lee samnite crasses killed sixe thousand sunne rise manye sunnethe fourth battel samnite novv abr zo set three romaine beyng killed seauen hurt great alteration victorie executio punishmente spartacus loking horseman come vnto nowe come forth men tymes spartacus holden much annoy besieger sodaynely issuing vppon throwing firebrandes campe burned wall put much difficulty trouble romaine captiue hung vp middest campe shewing souldiours suffer ouercome romaine citie seing siege thinking dishonor long holden swordplayer appointed pompey returned fro iberia army waying difficultie thing take charge therof crassus seeing glory pompey appointed vva war shold taken pompey made hast trie spartacus spartacus thinking preuent pompey would haue made agreemet crassus reiected thought proue vttermost horseman come issued campe al band fled fast coulde brunduse crassus following heard lucullus come brunduse army warre mithridates desperation thing encou tred crassus fight long difficulte among many souldiours driuen desperation spartacus hurtethe last battel vvherin spartacus vvas aint thygh dart wounde falling knee defended himselfe shield foughte came vpo many ouerthrew till co panies discomfited multitude without order fled killed wythout number romaine thousand slayne spartacus dead neuer founde great multitude fro battaile went mountaines agaynste whome crassus followed diuiding themselues fortye partes fought oute till slaine saue sixe thousande taken hanged way betweene rome capua ch e citie c ip contention betvvene crassus pompey crassus seketh consul syllas appoyntment pompey auntient maner chosen consels thys dyd crassus sixe moneths contending pompey glorie would leaue armye bycause pompey woulde leaue sought consull crassus hauing bene pretor according syllas law pompey neither hauing bin questor pretor yet xxxiij yeares age promised tribune reduce office antiet aucthoritie chosen consul neyther would leaue army pompey sayde would stay metellus make triumph iberia crassus affirmed pompey ought first giue ouer people peceyuing discorde readye ryse andthe people require reconciliation two army hand requested consul sitting place come recocilation first denyed southsayers declaring great grieuous calamites follow vnlesse agreede people agayne lamentation desire recording miserable time sylla crassus relenteth first marius thing crassus beyng moued rose firste seate came take pompey hand reconciled pompey rose also hast came fast hym one embraced another gret thankes showtes gyue vnto people would let depart til determined dissolution army contention al men opinion seemed woulde haue grown great happily ended lx yeare ciuil warre death tiberius gracchus end first booke ciuil dissentions second booke appian alexandria mischiefe inconuenience wel one determined execute without iudgement apparant offender cicero brought euery one senate yet sitting comon prison without knowledge people put death went common place told haue liued wherat dispersed feare glad hide theselues wel could citie present great feare receyued little comfort cateline nowe gathered xx armed fourth part going preparation antonie consul encountred alpes without great ado ouerthrew one suriously taken horrible thing hand whiche came triall without order erecuted spane yne ne although neither none noble yt conspiracie would agree flee bycause accepted people yet accuse hym disparaging holye sacrifice c r speake hym caesar called gyue witnesse said nothing rather made hym tribune people ntrap c er spake againste alliaunce three men thing tending tyra ny thus griefe giue place gaine one benefited another mighte bee hindred shoulde seeme clodius gratifyed caesar getting hys office fraunce thinges didde caesar beyng consull hee hadde gyuen ouer one office hee strayghte coueted another clodius accused cicero hee hadde contrarie lawe putte death lentulus cethegus senate giuen sentence cicero matter vsed moste noble courage nowe called answere verye fainte harted hee put mourning vesture ful weeping sorrowe humbled himselfe met streates beeing ashamed trouble neuer knew behauior vnseemely yt haue pitied laughed scorne great fearfulnesse one cause owne fallen yt life done gloriously others euen say demosthenes athes able answeredemosthenes cause condened fled away clodius spite mock lowlinesse abroad whereby brought desperatio also tooke volutary banishmet many friend going forth senate recommending city king prince clodius pulled downe hys clodius pulleth dovvn house citie country pleased hymself well thys act would need compare pompey greatest auctoritie citie wherfore called milo fellow clodie bolder man hee putting hym hope consulship againste fellow make decree cicero returne supposing cicero woulde nowe deale matter action clodie busy hymself speaking presente auctoritie thus cicero pompey caste oute called home sixteenth moneth banishment hys house fermes builded common coste receyued great remedy catos catos perswasion pompey co sull alone perswasion chose consull without felowe haue authoritye dictator ruling alone yet answerable bicause consul first consul two great prouinces armye rose thys therefore neede present medicine also decreed man would might cal men account first consulship time twentie yeares caesar consul caesar friendes suspecting done despite calui tion long time comprehended exhorte deale present matter rather looke backward trouble men honorable among naming casar offended one voide susp tion cont appoynted time seconde consulship saide necessarie begin make
