dagger though fact yet woulde haue parte prayse lentulus spintor fauorinus aquinus dolobella murcus peticus wer notthey sought prayse found payne partaker glorie afterwarde tasted punishment offender common people came made doubtful feare senate although ignoraunce tumult fled yet good truste kinsefolkes friend could euil beare tirannie people suspected andthe e many serued caesar warre whereof fewe present citie discharged warfare appointed habitation bin dwelling place come go iourney wyth caesar afrayde also lepidus army citie antony consull leaste would vse people leauing senate worke displeasure thus bestad wente capitoll swordeplayers consulting best done seemed good giue largesse people hoping beganne prayse act wold folow loue liberty desire common wealth thoughte people rome sincere heard olde brutus expelled king vnderstanding loked two thing contrarye themselues loue libertie would corrupted profitable present wherof ye one easie state ye part corrupted people wascauses corruption rome mirt stranger libertyne equal citizen fashion seruant like maisters senate ercept rest indifferet seruantes distribution corne vsed rome giuen distribution corne poore brought yt idle needie vacabonds italy rome nuber olde worne souldiers wage deuided coutries wer wont seuerally bicause serued vniust war would go comon habitationsmaisterle men take men land house remayning togither teples comon place vnder one baner one chiefe yt might apoint prouince selling away redy go sone bought reward therfore hard cassius gather nuber men bring ye comon place albeit hired yet durst prayse yt done feare caesar glory others deuotion ye comon welth sake cried peace earnestly exhorted ruler vnto thys deuise kyllers worke theyr owne safetye coulde bee peace vnlesse forgetting standyng termes cynna pretor kinsemanne maryage caesar cynna accuseth caesar beyonde opinion came among hauing hys vesture office threw giuen tiran called caesar tiranne kylled hym killer tiranne praysed facte moste like progenitours men called capitoll honoured dew rewardes cinna sayde seeing vncorrupted people myxte wyth call capitol anye thing else onely exhorted peace dolabella yongdolabella man noble appointed consull caesar ben gone reste yeare hauing garment consul mace office second spake euill pretended priuie deuise sorte hand saye hee decreed daye shoulde honoured byrth day citie hyred men toke harte saw pretor consul forgiue called cassius rest temple glad dolabella yong noble man consul meete match cassius people antony came downe cassius marcus brutus bloudy hand striue giue caes r moste woundes amiddest people spake nothing humbly noble euident thing one praysed another calling citie blessed attributing muche decimus fitte time bad serued swordplayers stirred people woulde thing worthy auncestours whiche expelled king reigning violence caesar chosen lawfully also propouded sextus pompey sonne pompey greate hadde made warre agaynste caesar common wealth myght called home beyng yet armes spayne againste caesar captaines lykewyse c setius marul depriued banished caesar tribune people hadde thus sayde wente vppe againe capitoll dyd truste verye muche multitude friendes kinsfolke might repaire vnto temple chose auntient send lepidus antony reconciliation regarde libertie saue countrey euils might growe vnlesse foreseene much messenger require praysing ye thing done durst caesar friend desired haue borne worthynesse doer hate loue countrey pitie citie nowe consumed continuall sedition whiche one would vtterly destroy good men right hate amongst shoulde worke publike destruction rather publike commodity priuate enmity mighte wiped away antonius lepidus sayde minded reuenge caesar deathe eyther friendship sake orthe deuice antony lepidus practise betweene desire rule thynkyng thing would easier notable men might ridde way yet feared friendes theyr kinsfolkes senate enclined decimus whome caesar hadde appoynted gouerne france theyr neyghboure whereby hadde mighty armye therfore thought best tarry better occasion deuise gette decimus army valiant expert laboures neuer left hauing fetch antony thus aunswered messenger priuate displeasure worke nothing antonyes aunsvvere offence matter wherein sworne caesar bee keeper body defend violence requisite oth follow fact done rather lyue pure daunger execration yet honor opinion debate senate house take way citie common consent shall seeme good thus antony aunswered safelye gaue thankes departed sure hope al haue gone well senate woulde haue fauoured cause throughly antony meane time caused officer make watche citie nighte turne keepe seates wante daye haue fire ouer citie meane whereof friend ye offendoures went euery senatoures house requested themselues countreys common wealth ranne abroade also captaynes suche haue habitation threatning mischiefe vnlesse performe lad place giuen promised sincere sort citie tooke good hearte perceiuing smal number doer enclyned memorie caesar diuers opinion caesar money bookes doings carryed antonie casars money vv itings sent antony eyther bycause calphurnie danger hir house send antony surer antony commaund done decree made antony nighte call senate daye temple goddesse earth farre owne house neyther durst goe tothe senate temple god earth senate house capitoll bycause sworde player gathered bring armye towne troubling notwithstanding lepidus brought day drawing nigh senatoures came temple goddesse earth cinna pretor hauing agayne garmet day throwen giuen tyrant made hast thither whome parte vncorrupted people parte caesar souldioures sawe beeyng rage bycause daye firste openly spake euill caesar beeyng hys kinsman threwe stone hym anda tault droue hym house gote woodde haue burned lepidus come army forbydden firste token whereby caesar friendes hadde confidence conspiratoures hyred fellowes afrayde senate house fewe pure violence contention parte diuers deuice fauoured manquellers thoughte worthye trust common consultation offender make judge whiche antony dyd lette bycause knewe woulde come dyd indeede ing tryall senate earnestly playnely praysed facte namyng tyrantkyllers wylled shoulde rewarded denyed reward themselues desiring hauyng done intente thoughte iust commeded welldoers would allow commendation onely thoughte ynough forgyuen thus deuise forecast firste senate woulde encline little little myghte easier obteyne rest vncorrupted company abhorre acte wicked yet reuerence great house againste shoulde saued yet honored well doer coulde abide spake againste conuenient haue rest beloged safety shuld bee enuyed one sayde theyr honour shoulde bee caesar dishonoure aunswered fytte dead man shoulde bee preferred quicke another vehemently saying two thing one must chosen eyther declar caesar tyrante forgiue mercy tooke hold required voyces mighte tryed caesar oth decree made necessitie shoulde preiudice whyles ruled dyd nothyng freely feare themselues pompey beeyng slayne wyth hym manye thousande antony markyng thyngs deceytefully perceyuing ample euidente matter speech offered determined turne theyr cogitation wyth antony tte priuate care feare themselues vnderstandyng greate parte senatoures appoynted office priestehoodes citie gouernements armyes prouinces caesar tyme come hee shoulde bee long foorthe wyth hys armye space fyue yeares commaundyng silence consull thus sayde woulde haue boyces tryed vpon caesar must know antony afore ruled officer lawfully chosen hys actes decree must stande force violence wee thinke playd tyrant must body cast citie vnburyed actes reuoked wherfore see must medle wt world sea land many though would obey v shall declare heereafter apperteyneth v alone matter toucheth v put thing ea e platte may see shew harder thing manner haue borne office vnder caesar yet doe beare chosen made haue office time come lotte fals know appoynted fiue yeares yearely office citie regimentes countreys army willingly forgoe power would haue first determine proceede thus antony kindle fire caesar themselues helde peace throng shoutes starte vp denyed triall shoulde made voyces people thing appoynted assuredly holden vnder age mighte finde resistance election whome chiefly stirred whome dolabella consull one whome lawful consul election bycause fiue twenty yeares age wherefore shewed suddayne mutation pretended daye rebuking dolabella changed many thought conspiratours worthy honor office dishonored making securitie haue better shew put dolabella est hope shoulde rece ue thankes people straight resume dignity without alteration officer shewe lawfuller way common election shoulde ornament aduanced well authoritie people appoyntmente one ruler sooner spoken officer deceyue put robe rece e agayne lawfully perceyued craft thinke get election already matter standing thus antony lepidus wente senate house certaine came running multitude call seene aboue silece hardly put made much noyse one cryed vnto whether owne minde suborned bade take heed least suffered like antony losinga nevv st rr antony gowne shewed curet incensing looker though man coulde safe vnlesse ware armoure consull cryed fact might punished made request peace thus sayd consider shall fitte may auayle suretie hard found since neyther oth execration could profit caesar called reuenge turned commended carefull othes honestie would quoth youre captayne crye consul whome belongeth rather speake profite iustice doe within persuade v caesar himselfe profite citie sparing hadde taken warre destroyed thus wrought antony artificially thoughte fact punished required lepidus would punishe lepidus intending speake stoode farre prayed hym goe common place might heare indifferently wente straight forth opinion people mind new turned come place speech lamented weeping thus sayd heere yesterday lepidus people caesar heere enquire caesar deathe haue done many cryed reuenge caesar hyred men cryed peace citie whome hee sayd peace speake othes sure countrey othes ha e sworne caesar compted least sweare haue troden vnder foote turned cryed reuenge caesar sayd gone v holy honored man deede afrayd hurte citie left senate treate manye thinkes good cryed alone take hand wyll sayd iust oth alone ynough alone doe alone fulfill andling matter thus craft ly hyred men knowing ambitioue praysed exhorted take office caesar priesthode glad sayde shall remember heereafter shall worthy caesar priestoode offered lepidue hired instant peace bycause liberall speech priesthoode sayde although vniust wicked yet doe bycause said returned senate house dolabella time bin importune continuance office antony gathering people humor looked ouer hym wyth smiling countenance finding dissent among themselues people doe nothing earnestly hauing beholden sufficiently determined saue hiding one necessitie another shuld saued especial grace caesar actes cofirmed decree senate order take effect therfore silence comanded sayd thus citizen offendoures men equall honor consultation haue sayd nothing contrarywise ny senate desired tryall caesar put forthe onely one decree hath withoute cause kept contention tyll time doe refuse office shall confesse many worthy men vnworthily haue receyued co sider easie hard number mindes city nation kingdomes region maye say thing fro east weast caesar vertue vanquished v power subdued law clemencie curtesie made assured vnto hym thinke wil beare depriued thing haue enioyed vnlesse wil fyll warres desirous heale youre countrey nowe feeble wyth disease farre kepte downe feare fight wil omitte touch may say euen home italy haue receyued reward victory multitude army wherewith serued caesar appoynted habitation institution whereof many thousand within citie thinke wil take looked haue city countreys thys last night shew v image matter whe intreate offendoures contrary ranne aboute threatnings thinke abide see caesar body violated torne vnburyed thing law wente done againste tyrant whiche haue serued warres haue gayne gotten victory france england confirmed vnto gyuer despightfully handled thinke people rome thinke italian hate shal haue god man defile empire enlarged oceane sea people vnknowen shall lacke reproufe blame youre inconstancie thinke worthy honor killed consull counsell house holye man holy place senatoures doer sighte god dishonor enimies honored thing vnlawfull power warne refrayne thys sentence giue caesar actes decree doe remayne firme stable offender praysed wise godly iust consonant caesar actes ratified mercye onely pardon friend kinsfolkes sake accept confesse thakeful part antony said great contention vehemency decree made silent content action caesar death actes decree confirmed commodious citie much adoe friend thedecrees offendoures cause added safetie kepte iustice sake profite antony gaue place vnto decree head men set habitation desired priuate decree common authoritie place inhabitance myghte bee made sure vntoa decree habitation antony agaynste shewing feare senate decree made another like went inhabitation counsell thus broken vp pers oded lucius piso whome caesar lest testamente neyther brought forthe body buryed openly ment least mighte breede newe tumult citie otherwise minded threatned called aunswer defrauded people substance due common treasure agayne making signification tyrannie piso cryed lowde could praying consul yet present goe counsell againe sayde haue affirmed one tyrant taken away steede people one tyrant vnto v forbidding bury holy priest threaten bring forth last make confiscation goodes tirant actes maketh ratifie hath left himselfe reuoke brutus cassius incense mischiefe sepulture lordes testament shall suffer dectyued trust faith man taketh away breath much stirre businesse rise among specially supposed get somewhat testament therefore thought conuenient testament brought abroade body shoulde buryed caesar testament openly counsell rose brutus cassius vnderstanding send multitude call capitoll many came running thither greate hast brutus sayd thus nowe citizen heere yesterday common court fleeyng temple people haue done amisse fort hauing committed wee haue sharpe strage mishap cinna haue copelled v thus haue herd hath bin obiected v oure enimies touching oth touching cause doubt peace suretie haue say herein citizen conferre whome haue concerning common matter caius caesar fro france inuaded countrey enimies armes pompey singulare fauourer people suffered euery man knoweth hym nuber good citizen wente iberia libya destroyed desire gaue security seeme afrayde himselfe seking make tyrany sure sware vnto required v swere confirme thing past also haue bene hys slaues time come woulde haue done nowe lie wayte liues suppose verye romaine indeede wyll rather choose certaine death haue oft done othe abyde willing seruitude caesar hitherto haue gone aboute nothing make v seruile confesse haue broken othe neyther office citie prouinces country army dignity church assigning inhabitance honour left v cosent senate allowance people owne commaundement ambition neuer satiate syllas ouerthrown enemy restored v common wealth making another armye long time toke awaye election fiue yeares libertie hope coulde appeare say people chiefe officer sesetius marullus contumely thrust fro sacred inuiolate office lawe othe auncestours suffer actio made tribune yet caesar banished shewed cause whither haue offeded holy tribune caesar sacred inniolate man willingly necessitie graunted thing came agaynst country armour killed many noble citizen office tribune holy inniolated whiche father time common welth dyd sweare without co pulsion intent haue euerlasting reuenewe accompt empire became brake open treasure house will caught money vntouched vnremouable thretned death tribune resisted oth saye shall sufficient preserne peace tyranne needes oth forefather neuer neede anye wil aspire tyrannie fayth othe romames tiranne thus speake perill euer speake country honoure safety caesar preferred honour countrey owne wel vse calumniation againste v stirre habitation present eyther hath shalbe appointed inhabitance pray much request giue token selues many dyd sayde oh well done good men come conuenient indifferentlye doe trauayle laboure youre countrey shoulde receyue equal reward people rome appoint caesar againste english french men therefore reason hauing done good seruice receyue good reward bound oths vnwillingly led citie led likewise beste citizen libya likewise wils trauayle ben paraduenture would haue bin ashamed ashe recompence seruice france england enuie time obliuion man put memorie beste recompence people wont giue old souldiers taking away men landes house offended giuing one others thinking ought recompence iniustice conquered enimies take away land made particion appointed souldiers dwel garrison co quered place many time land wold suffise eyther diuided common bought newe people place without others displeasure sylla caesar inuaded countrey enimyes hauing need garde garison vpon theyr countrey dyd neyther send liue owne countryes bought land bestowed vpon got vpon composition restored honour whome taken althoughe treasure conquered lande toke italy offended done thing amisse lawe warre rather robbery land house sepulchre temple would take greatest strange enimyes setting ta e tenth part vpon haue made diuition owne countreymens sente serue caesar frenche war made many vowes victory appointed company conuenient dwelling place ensignes discipline souldiours neyther enioye peace sure thrust euer put spoyled hys owne remaine spie tune euen cause tirannes would let haue land mighte haue bene giuen meanes hauing euer enimies laye wayte shoulde sure kepers power whiche iniustice contine good tirans haue garde far wrong feare themselues god cal cohabitation wherby lament countreymen mighte made insurrection haue done wrong purpose haue made v enimies countrey olk singular profit chiefe officer countrey say saue v mercy sake confirme pres tly herafter wil confirme bond euer take god witnesse ye haue shal haue al haue none shall take fro brutus cassius liberty haue put al selues peril e accused matter saue selues allied friend special cofort pleasant heare first occasio shal offered wil giue price land take fro comon reuenew shall onely haue setting setled also voyde al e combraunce whi e brutus thus spake al hearer cosidering selues spake nothing right like wel men courage louers people great admiration turned fauour determined doe good next day whiche come consul called people assembly repeated opinion men cittie therfore let v send thys holy one number blessed sing due hymne mourning verse saide thus pulled vp gowne lyke man antoni gesture time tunerall caesar beside hymselfe gyrded might better caesar shape shevved vvaxe shewed litter image caesar made ware hys vody selfe lying flat litter could seene hys picture deuise turned xxiij wouds wer shewed ouer al body face horrible behold people seeing pittifull picture coulde beare dolour longer butchange people de senate house set fire vvherein caesar vvas killed one cynna k led thronged togyther beset senate house wherein caesar kylled set fyre kyllers fledde liues ranne sought euery place outragiouslye anger dolour kylled cynna tribune name lyke cynna pretor spake euill caesar wold tarry heare declaration name cruelly tore peeces lefte returned litter caried holye thing buried holy place among god bicause priest deny brought hym againe common place pallaice old king al bourds tymber could find place muche beside euery man broughte receyued xiij woudes body euer inuincible alwayes getting victory first second battayle subdued manye barbarous nation alexander europe ouercame grecian valiant people louing libertie obeying none philip litle whyle honour appeare feates warre asia man may say ranged ouer briefely tell fortune empire much land saw gotte conceyuing determining conquest rest mind destroyed caesar ionian sea gane boate badde mayster let sayles go winde trust caesar fortune sea enimses alone hath lepte many tymes reste haue bin afraide alone fighte frenche thirtie time til subdued fourtie nation whiche terrible romaine olde holy menal age degree must striue frech lawe priuiledged warre except french enimie came horse olde men muste go foorth alexandria left alone fight bridge beset euery side threwe purple leapte sea sought hys enmmies diued bottome greate sometime rose take breath til friendly shippe came nighe hym whome helde vp hand shewed himselfe saued falling ciuill war eyther feare say desire rule hee didde matche wyth valiauntest captaines tyme many great battailes barbarian onelye also romaine whiche manhoode fortune dydde excel ouercame eyther firste seconde battatle hys armye inuincible alexander caesar los e sometymes france c tta titurus hys lieutenant euidently ouercome greate losse spaine petreius aff anius helde hym besieged dyrrachio libya fled fowly awaye spaine afraide young pompey caesar himselse euer voide feare ende euerye warre victorie romaine empire weaste floude euphrates euphrates floud macedonia running redde sea babylon force fayre meanes obtayned muche surer stronger sylla shewed hymselfe king spight al though woulde receiue name also hauing made determination warre taken away besyde forth army alike prompte bothe beneuolente minde sighte lyke fiercenesse disobedient many time ful sedition long laboures neuerthelesse deade bothe one sorte lament mone thought worthy diuine honor body good complexion fayre bothe hadde petigree iupiter alexander aeacide hercules caesar alexander lyke caesar anchises venus desirous conquere whome contended easy entreated forgiue subdued beside forgiuenesse woulde good also seeking nothing else victory thus farre alyke rising rule lyke power one rose kingdome encreased alexander caesar vnlyke hys father phillip priuate estate yet noble renoumed needy mony token whiche great alyke contemners yet neyther angrye wyth diuiners didde foreshewe death token like many time like effect twice bothe vnluckye signes whiche first shewed doubtfull danger alexander people india called malli plu th among oxidi ne scaling wall macedonian vtterly destitute breaking ladder leapte boldly among hys enimies within sore hurt ye breast necke beaten mighty mace wasperill alexander hardely saued macedonian shame burste open gate caesar spaine army fearefulperill caesar pompey young refused go fight betweene receyued ij c dartes vpon target armye ran feare shame saued hym firste vnlucky sacrifice didde signifie perill death seconde death selfe indeede pythagoras soothsayer tolde apollodorus afraide alexander ephestion shoulde neede feare sacrifice founde shoulde shortely bee dead comming passe ephestion died apollodorus afraide treason bin wroughte againste king tolde hym soothsaier sayde e smiled asked pythagoras token pretende aunswered laste day whereat smyled agayne thanked apollodorus hys faithfulnesse soothsayer confidence caesar haue sayde laste tyme hee wente senate token happened whereat laughed saide like seene spaine diuinour aunswered daunger nowe token signifieth certaine death r lenting somewhat free speeche sacrificed againe till tarryed long aboute sacrifice angry went kylled like happened alexander came india babylon army nigh chaldean exhorted hym refraine presente whome hee rehearsed verse best prophet coniectu eth honestly chaldean warned hym second tyme go wyth army weast side compasse take city alexander contemneth token easte stay say content beganne go angry moory fenny way contemned seconde warning went euphrates pallacotta floudes weaste sayled vpon euphrates floud pallacotta receyueth euphrates runneth fennes whereby assyria kept ouerflowing minded haue defended thys floud wall while sayling vpon say scorned chaldean bycause safely entred babylon come forth againe saile deferred till came againe dyed hande lyke contempt caesar seemed vse soothsayer caesar contemneth token hadde appoynted daye hys death saide hee shoulde passe ides march day come laughed hym sayd ides come day kylled despised prophe e alyke angry prophet yet dyed tolde studious learning vertue aswel coutry greek stragers alexader delighted brachmanes whiche among indian reputed moste learned prachm e vver vvise philosopers india chosen consent wise men magies among persian caesar dealte aegiptians putte cleopatra hys kyngdome wherby directed many ciuil thing rome among turned order yeare without certaintie bycause odde moneths measured moone course sunne aegiptians doe hys happe none dydde escape soughte hys death hys heyre receyued worthye punishemente alexander dydde kylled phillippe hys father howe done bookes order shall declare iudgemet put death stoutly senate marueled matter great beside law yet commoditie embraced ioyfully without stoutnesse thought brutus cassius could safetie companion amatius people loue much greued fact chiefly antony dispatche one honoured people could abide despised wherefore shoutes went cry antony commaunded magistrate erect aulter amatio make firste sacrifice caesar driuen common place aberius caesar secretary commaundement caesar goyng away lefte determination antony added many thing behoofe many men gaue graunts city prince owne garde made knowne coulde clayme thyng caesar assignation takyng benefite might yeelde antony abuset caesar testamet thankes meane brought many senate degree himselfe wan faire promise maligne agaynst garde brutus cassius perceiuing nothing neither people soldiours appeare peaceable neither vnlikely cospiracie amatio might done neither well abiding variable antony bare boldly army seyng people rule could cofirmed doings suspecting antony wrought put chiefe trust decimo three legion lying side italy wrote secretely trebonius asia tullius ythinia gather money closely loke aboute armye desirous take prouinces caesar appointed time yet suffer thought conuenient leaue office citie end run suspition desire rule nation chose rather necessitie spende meane time priuate men officer citie could neyther sure themselues anye thing honour seruice countrey case senate perceyuing minde thought good make purueyers grain cassius made purueyers citie euery countrey til time might serue take charge prouinces thus brutus cassius shoulde seeme flee great care reuerence chiefly mayntained killer brutus cassius wer gone citie antony nowe alone ruled coueted presidentship prouince armye therof chiefly desirous syria knowing alredy suspected thought required senat secretly wrought dolobella consul always strife antony antony seing dolobella yong man ambitious perswaded aske syria cassius place army made againste parthian aske senate expedient people law perswaded propounded lawe senate aleaged brake caesar actes answered war parthi appointed man caesar cassius sent syria first altered caesar decree giuing leaue wer assigned dwelling coutry sel portion twenty yeares determined lawa de ice e could take wel dolobella thought worthy syria cassius senate persuaded asprin one tribune find fault assebly toke hoping antony would haue allowed consul officer token stil thought variance dolobella electio come asprina affirming toke vnlucky maner send antony angry subtilty comaunded copanies make choyce dolobella dolabella made president dolabella president syria syria generall army parthian legion caesar gathered purpose left macedonia first time antony seemed fauoure dolabella done people antony required macedonia macedonia antony senate thinking would ashamed denye seeing dolabella syria nowe voyde office senate gaue vnwillingly maruelled woulde deliuer armye dolabella whome yet cyrene citie prouince affrica novv corciria creta ilande middest sea novv candia syrene creta brutus cassius octauius caesar nephevv valona vvhich side gulfe venice glad shoulde haue antony nowe brutus friendes thought good aske antony prouinces brutus cassius cyrene creta giuen saye creta syrene cassius bythinia brutus doings rome octauius caesar sister nephew made caesar generall horseman one yeare honor caesar vsed gyue friend yeare yeare yet yong sent caesar velona apply booke trayned feates warre remayne whilest wente againste enimies exercise himselfe band horseman came macedonia great captaynes armie resorted thither visit hym caesar kinsman whereby knowen many wanne loue army receyued came great curtesie hauing bin sixe monethes velona euening told caesar slayne senate house loued best might doe hym matter nothyng yet tolde stoode feare doubt whether whole publike worke senate priuate practise whether doer punished parte whose acte whether multitude ioyne thys friendes sente hym rome wishing goe host macedonia suretie place shuld knowen common fact might terror enimies reuenging caesar diuers captaynes promised woulde come woulde see hym safe mother philip father lawe wrote vnto take nothing vpon encouraged remembring caesar hadde ouercome enimies thus vsed deerest friendes priuate life prosent octauius sayleth italy perill nowe rather chosen rome well kept octauius persuaded without knowledge done caesar deathe embracing captaynes sayled ouer ionian sea taking land brunduse bycause trust army therefore well ware another citie farre called lupio stayed receyued lupio iezze port tovvne aduertisementes friend caesar deathe people tumult publication testamente order taken aduised beware caesar enimies bycause named sonne heire counselled take inheritance vpon thinking dishonor wel reuege caesar death wet brunduse sedyng afore search none striker anye awaite army place meete receyued caesar sonne good courage made sacrifice andthe army brunduse receyueth octauius adoption straightway accepted name caesar romaine vsed giue name whome made child adoption admitte changed name fro octauius octauius sonne caesar caesar sonne continued till ende great repaire caesar friendes seruantes freemade men octauius receyued name caesar souldioures bringing preparation money toward macedonia reuenues prouinces brunduse trusting vpon multitude came vnto caesar glory beneuolence tooke iourney toward rome accompanyed conuenient number dayly like streame increase safe open force multitude people without suspitio deceypt bycause came almost newe acquaintace euery citie fauour caesar souldioures appoyntmet placed came fromresort yong caesar habitation fauour yong man lamented caesar complayned antony woulde reuenge great mischiefe affirming man woulde guide would reuenge death octauius caesar gaue great prayse willed quiet time came terracina fiftie mile rome told syria macedonia taken brutus cassius consul comforte creta syrene graunted certayne banished men reuoked pompey restored many made senatoures caesar determination diuers thing come rome mother philip friendes came vnto againe prayed dissente senate bycause decreed shoulde question caesar deathe feared antony power neyther came himselfe meete caesar sonne sent man receyue hym whiche octauius tooke temperately said wasin desire octauius meete goe first antony yong man elder priuate man consul would obserue senate conuenient though quoth decree man persecute killer yet anye durst take hand bath people senate law good iustice yea peraduenture antony also wyll help refuse inheritace adoptio offend againste caesar defraude people distribution end knit vp speech onely honest put himselfe dager matter also neede lose life otherwise seeme vnworthy choyce caesar made great matter seeing wont contemne maner perill turning mother octauius vvords mother rehearsed word achilles spake thetis rather wish life ende omitte reuengement friend word quoth winne achilles immortall fame much deede ought reuenge caesar friende father fellowe souldiour generall dying lawe warre murthered wickedly senate house speeche mother feare turned embraced affirming worthy caesar talke ended prayed myghte haue lucky prosperous successe speede yet perswaded firste rather vse policie sufferance playnenesse boldnesse commending hir aunswered would nighte sent friendes prayed nexte morning comon place wyth multitude place meeting caius antonius brother marcus antonius pretor citie sayde vnto accept adoption caesar manneradoption rome adopted child exhibite testimonie pretor beyng registred straighte wente common place antony con ull pompey gardings whiche caesar giuen hee tarryed gate long whyle entred suspitionthe meeting octauius antony antony alteration length lette due salutation intretaynmets betweene bycause must talke thing expedient octauius caesar sayd thus father antony benefites caesar shewed thee octauius oration antony thankes thou gauest requiring thee father r e prayse thee thing thou hast done thy debtor thankes wherein maye blame thee speake frankely dolor doth thereto driue slayne thou wast present quellers holding thee withoute dores eyther shouldest thou haue saued haue bin like daunger thy selfe whych latter must haue happened well thou wast absente decreed honored againste tyrant thou denyedst effectually whych know thou successour deseruest cleere thankes thou knowest men conspire thy death one woulde reuenge caesar thinke tyrantkillers fled capitoll sanctuary like offendors crauing merc e sorte enimies strength wherefore obliuion acquitall murther required though senate people corrupted thou hadst bin otherwise minded thy office require thee punish great fault correct erre yet diddest thou send pledge thine owne capitoll assurance manquellers well graunt corrupted sort force thee caesar testament redde thou madest funerall oration righte people fresh memorie caesar carryed fire againste neyghboures sake spared agayne armes twice next day didst thou help people leader fire armoure punishe murtherers punishment ought euident offendors thee friende caesar consull antony marius amatius commaundement thy great power put deathe quellers thou susferedst slee runne certayne prouinces wrongfully holde hauing killed gaue syria macedonia thou dolabella doyng well thinges setled tooke whiche would thanke thee thou hadst straight appoynted creta cyrene thought fugitiues worthy prouinces euer garrison decimus hauyng france neybour haue suffered also made ruler father say senate determine yea thou didst confirme satest chiefe senate thou chiefly others thy selfe oughtest haue resisted giue obliuion faul granting liues assigne prouinces honor contumelie caesar ouerthrow iudgement therefore passion dothe carrie peraduenture beyonde due respect yeares reuerence thee speake sure friende caesar though worthye much honor power also one mighte haue bin heire knowen thou hadst come aeneas rather hercules muche consider tooke order succession tyme come antony god friendship dutie caesar thou wilt change thing done thou must thou wilt least help minde reuenged ye quellers people father friend haue respect men senate doth moue thee angry thou knowest charge house haue matter performing distribution father gaue people care thereof delaying might seeme vnthankefull yt receyue habitation countrey shoulde consumed tarrying citie al thee brought immediately ye death caesar safetie danger house iewels apparel thinke good thou shalt haue al thing thou wilt distributio giue coyned gold gathered determinate warres shall suffice deuide amog three hudred thousand residue charge may bold eyther thee thy helpe borowe publike money forthwith make sale priuate substance whilest caesar spake thus antony astonished courage boldnesse farre beyond opinio yeares greeued speech made without reuerence specially required money answered sharply manner caesar togither inheritace name sonne antonyes aunsvvere left thee also state thou mightest well haue required accompt common thing must haue aunswered romaine haue oth decreed man shall receyue rule inheritance man successour king whome expell whiche chiefly obiected againste father quellers affirming killed king captayne ought aunswere thee touching publike cause reason deliuer thee gyuing thankes whiche thou owest therefore done thy sake people yet one greatest actes euer done caesar thee mine owne boldnesse hate ouerpast honor striker killer tyrante caesar bin iudged tyrant whome neyther glory honor establishmente actes bin made neyther testament sonne substace bin stayd bodye bin thought worthy buriall priuate man law doth commaund bodyes tyrant cast vnburied memorie raced theyr goodes made common fearing contend caesar immortall glorye publike buriall neyther without perill enuie mine owne person men fierce full bloudshed thou mayst know conspiring agaynste senat could euill beare thy father gouernement thought rather offer selfe peril trouble suffer caesar dishonored vnburyed best men fortunate affaire vsing honorably mine onely peril thou hast presently singulare benefites caesar bloud name hys dignitie substance whyche thou oughtest rather giue thankes reprehende anye thyng done appeasing senate recompence deserued commodity consideration seeyng thou art yong respect therefore shall sufficient thou spakest heerein thou doest glance mee though desirous rule neuer coueted yet haue bin thought altogither vnworthy thou sayest sory made heire testament yet thine owne confession content petigree hercules thy necessitie thou wouldest borrow common treasure thinke thou didst dissemble bycause thou canst ignorant cosumed thy father ye receypt reuenue since came authoritie brought steade ye treasure house found substance whe determined search ca wrog caesar dead called vniust though wer aliue yt required would yeeld thee accopts whe thou shalt find ye many priuate men cotend wt thee hys goodes thou shalt wel perceiue thou c st obteine without great controuersie money thou sayest left wyth neyther summe greate nowe handes distributed officer magistrate tyrant goodes dolabella breethren onely excepted bestowed vpo purpose caesar appointed whe thou shalt haue rest thou shalt bestow rather vpon may hinder thee tha people thou beest wise whome sende away wise habitation people thou oughtst know lately trayned greeke letter vnstable euer mouing waues sea nowpeople vnstable comming going sorte people haue set alo te oure ambitious men broughte downe lowe agayne octauius beyng greeued many thing tended contumelie wente way often calling vpon father name put sale whole substance came octauius selleth substance vnto inheritance coueting winne people thys liberalitie bycause antony appeared manifest enimie vnto senate intending make enquirie decree publike treasure many afrayde yong caesar beneuolence father souldyers people present large e alluring consuming substance verye greate many thinkyng woulde liue rate priuate man chieflie antony woulde agree bycause yong famous rich would still vsurp caesar former dominion ioyfull thing men shoulde variance inquisition money caesar ryches wast haue abundance common treasure bycause muche publike store would found among caesar goodes manye called caesar lawe land euery one clayming owne muche common reason condemned banished attaynted men controuersies brought antony dolabella consul matter heard judge caesar euer worst bycause antonyes friendship albeit shewed record father purchased al act ratifyed last decree senate many action iniurie put vp againste extraordinarily grew infinit much pedius pinarius caesar giuen portion land complayned antony theselues caesar suffered wrog senate decree affirming ought reiect onely matter despight al caesar doings confirm answered thing done peradueture contrarietie senate decree quoth decree may written contrary meaning obliuion iniuries graunted alteratios former proceeding neyther sake playne anye sake rather deuice apea e stay people tumulte iuste vse meaning decree rather wordes neyther meete resist many men sedition fallen owne auncestours possession one yong man beyonde hope gotten muche men substaunce none owne vsing fortune honoure insolencie yet sayd would fauour whe diuided caesar thus antony answere pinarius streight made diuision least partes shoulde consumed sutes themselues caesar long must gratify time playes drew nygh caius antonius brother antony exhibite brutus pretor absentplayes brutus good sortas might bicause brutus made great
