purpose went euery common market commaunding proclamed yt sel al good thoughe neuer good cheape bycause doubtful suspitious controuersie lawe harte whereby hee turned people beneuolence pitie vnworthye suffer muche whereas beside owne heritage solde priuate substaunce ca e father octauius waye mother hir husband philip hadde clayming portion good pedius pinarius determined sell though caesar substaunce woulde suffice onely bycause v ratio people thinking loger caesar gifte octauius liberalitie inwarde compassion wondring great attemptes well perceyuing would long passe antony displeasure playes brutus shewed ample mannerthe playes disturbed certaine hyred men cry brutus cassius might called home rest theatre agree vnto pardon rushed heapes marred playe quenched instant request brutus cassius vnderstanding caesar dashed hope shewe determined goe syria macedonia force prouinces appointed antony dolobella euident dolobella also went syria made hast way make money asia antony desired much haue army macedonia fit maintenace power vertue best power sire legion beside number archer darter light armed many horseman greate furniture warre al whiche feared follow dolobella syria going parthian whether caesar appointed minded haue bycause nyghe sea ionia fro whence might soone bringthe g ta e people sythia europe name novv turned thracian italie meane time sodaine rumor came geetes knowing caesar death inuade macedonia wherfore antony required armie senate myght punish geetes bycause first appointed caesar nowe quiet wyth parthian senate suspected rumor sente vnderstande certainty antony deliuer feare suspition hereof decreed antony deuiseth stoppe creation dictator cause lawfull create dictator man take though giuen man perceyue anye contemne order shoulde lawfull kill wheresoeuer mette meanes temper hearer practising dolobellas friend giue one legion chosen captaine army lieuetenant macedonia hauing hee would sent brother caius al hast cary decree army wente vnderstande geetes returned affirmed sawe geetes macedonia added either saying true taught antony shold say feared army taken away geetes would ouerrunne macedonia while rome cassius brutus gather money men trebonius gouernour asia dolobella kept ephesus novv ogli ion dolobella taketh yr make city strong woulde admit dolobella neither pergamo smirna onlyhe appointed market place wals consul therfore went anger winne walles trebonius obtayning promised receiued ephesus going thither trebonius sent certaine aloofe see doings night come seeing going suspecting anye thing else lefte fewe followe hym returned smirna dolobella hauyng layde wayte thys matter turned vppon fewe slewe streight nighte came smirna whyche findyng without watche toke wyth scale trebonius founde bedde desyred hee mighte bee broughte dolobella hee woulde wyllinglye followe one captaynes loked hym sayd come giue v thy heade thy heade thee commaunded bring thus sayde stroke hys heade streighte daye come dolobella caused trebonius heade set vp ouer iudgemente place wher wotto giue audiece army fury folowed killed p ghtfully vsed cape people b cause trebonius priuy caes deth helde antony tale without killed caesar senate house vse body spightfully threw head vpon pauemet stone like balfro one another trebonius one con ita or vv first vva killed whe scornefully vsed crushed brake piece first caesar striker receiued punishment antony intended bring army macedonia italie wanting pretence thervnto desired senate steade macedonia might haue fraunce within alpes de u brutus albinus ruler remembring caesar brought army thence ouercame novv pompey perceyued minded bring army italy fraunce senat considering part fraunce strong sort grieued vnderstoode deceytes antony repentingsenate vvorketh e etly antony giuen macedonia vnto hym therefore sent pri e messenger decimus kepe prouince strongly gather army money might resiste antony muche troubled anger antony contrary senats minde entending aske people lawe caesar obtayned dolabella syria late afra senate commaunded brother caius transport army shevv macedonia ionian sea brunduse doe antony require nowe playes hewed itonius hou e vvel pro n holy ouers r victual whiche caesar hadde prepared crowne chayre golde father al shewes ordeyned honour c sayde woulde admitte caesar honored charge make wherefore octa n brought antony consul antony sayd would put senate whereat octauian offended doe quoth set chaire till thou ha e made decree antony angry forbad hym forbadde also playes made somewhat vnreasonable octauius hymselfe exhibit instituted hys father venus parent whome common place hee builded temple wyth cou te thys manifeste hate grewe agaynste antony men thought rather octauius caesar th n contemne former vnthankfully young caesar mu tude guarde wente among people bin benefited hys father serued hym war u ouslye hee besoughte woulde suffer hym thus many way despised reuenge caesar chiefetayne benefactour dishonoured antony desen e themselues haue none assurance vnlesse thing decreed established went vp euery highe place citie cried vpon antony angry caesar dishonor hath antony moste honoured thee antony moste affectionated thee n ury thou wilt saue substaunce spoile till citizen haue parte reste take vnto thee shal sufficient though poore successor hys glorye thou wilte suffer people haue portion wordes euident continuall exclamation againste antony although sharpelye threatned octauius hys threat openly known yet irre wherfore chiefe capitains serued antony guard great estunation wyth hym andthe antony uour octauinus bin caesar desired woulde leaue dispight well cause hauing serued vnder caesar receyued many good turnes thing antony consideryng confessing true halfe ashamed shoulde layde vpon hym nowe shoulde haue neede octauians helpe prouince france beganne lengthe bee quiet shewe antony eth thyngs doone againste hys wyll bycause young manne hawtie yeares hee dydde reuoke certaine thynges hadde regarde reuerence capitaines olde officer yet theyr sake woulde reframe hys anger returne olde condition hee also woulde leaue hys insolent behauiour captaines gladde brought togither declared grief set one nowreconciliation antony octaui law called vppon france senate entending prohibite antony woulde propounde hee didde require people woulde set tribune againsteit woulde haue free al lieutenant ouer nation muche afraide antony obiect vnto would truste decimus one caesar killer distruste hym kill hym wanne prouince made fall knee casting forth openly al though bin desirous doone caesar courte daye come senate willed assemblythe senate taketh ard companyes gathered night sette vppe tentes common place called bande souldioures desende happes people offended laboured antony helpe octaui sate among tentes entreated novve eth antony hym hee much afraid least decimus shoulde gouernoure prouince suche importaunce armye greate beeyng one hadde kylled hys father thys cause hee beganne fauoure antonie wyth whome reconciled trusting gette good hys hande tribune corrupted antony keping silencetribunes corrupted lawe tooke place armye nowe sea reasonable consideration assigned antonie one tribune dead octauius much fauoured flaminius next election bycause people thought people mindeth make octauius himselfe woulde haue office refused aske bycause yong yeares determined neuerthelesse election make tribune senate enuy encrease afraide tribune would accuse father killer people antonie regarding breake friendship octauius whither please senate quiet mind late lawe made hys prouince antony againste octauius aga sake shoulde go inhabite consull hee decreed caesar shoulde deale man lawfullye otherwise woulde al mean auctoritie hym thys declaration beyng vnpleasaunte caesar contumelious bothe hym people angrye entended make stirre election affraye antonie sedition procured helpe tribune reuoke decree octauius casar one euidently deceyued sente manye citties hys father made inhabite shew hee vsed knowe mind therin sent also cariers victual antony campe mingle among chiefelye deale wyth boldest among reste scatter libells thus hee dydde capitaines chiefe men antony finding time conuenient saide thus vnto wee antonie wyth thee haue serued caesar oration capitaynes antony gaue hym chiefe aucthoritie till daye haue remayned assured seruauntes haue knowne hys killer senate fauouring didde muche hate seeke dispatch v people disturbe encouraged agayne bycause wee sawe caesar forgotten lacked friendes destitute fauoure yet wee put truste thee caesar friende nexte acquainted seruice warre nowe generall al respect sit enimies rise boldly force syria macedonia prepared mony men v senate maintainyng decimus thou consuming tyme contention caesar octauius without cause afraide tyme come thys dissention etweene woulde raise greater warre hathe beene gyue occasion ennimies woulde againste v whyche seeyng thy selfe doest vnderstande beseeche thee casars sake oure loue whiche hath doone nothing offend thee commodity may rise thee v whilest thou mayest thou wouldest agree octauius whiche onlye sufficient entending reuenged strykers whiche thing cleare care shall stay thee aucthoritie place v securitie doubt thee oure selues chiefetaynes hauyng sayde thus muche antony thus aunswered beneuolence loue haue euer borne caesar antonius captaynes hys cause offeryng selfe moste perills haue beene souldiour fare present euery thing hathe bin done well testifie muche loue good shewed euen till last day shall neede repeate quellers waying th se ut haue kylled thoughe coulde thinke intentes consiste safetye anye manne dydde affraye mynde doone desire care life respecte onelye woulde seeme persecute ennimies dispatche tyran thinke doe forgette caesar benefactour haue esteemed enimies woulde willingly forgyue death haue sought mine new caesar thinketh commeth obliuion deathe aduancemet prouinces obiecteth senate heare hathe come passe caesar slayne senate house euery man afrayd caesar friendship ignorance facte neyther hearde comuration vnderstoode howe manye conspirancie people tumulte striker swordplayers tooke capitoll made themselues fast senate side whyche nowe euident bycause decreed honor killer tyrant caesar tyrant must haue bin destroyed strayght friend tyrante beeyng troubled tumult feare sorrow coulde vse reason bee without perplexitie maye perceyue consider one side neede boldnesse vehemente dissimulation extreame firste thys done residue easlie followyng take away honor gyuen striker againste th whiche onely standyng resisted senate broughte passe greate payne vsing eindente courage onely offering selfe perill supposing wee caesar friendes suretie condemned tyrant lyke feare troubled enimies senate iudged tyrant shoulde accompted manquellers thys contention thoughte best gyue place allow obliuion hys death stead honor giuen mighte wynne muche necessitie coulde manner doings neyther dyd suffer caesar name abolished substance bee confiscate adoption whiche man nowe gloryeth dissolued testament frustrated hys bodye caused buryed princely honoures due vnto consecrated immortall actes decree kept firme sure hys sonne friend captaynes souldioures good safetie liue honor stead rebuke thinke obteyning thynges senate obliuion small trifle doe thynke wythout ob uion senate would haue graunted whyche cause thynke playnely bee performed true dealyng wyth striker animmortall glory caesar oure weale suretie whyche haue done purpose turne course contrarye hadde brought senate profitable v allowed killer remayne quiet ouerthrowe obliuion decree statute coulde earnest iealousie people bringing caesar bodye buryed common place causing hys woundes bee seene multitude shewyng vesture bloudy mangled declaring vertue beneuolence people weeping made mourning oration called hym name kylled god wordes workes whereby people prouoked stead obliuion tooke fire wente quellers house ende drone citie howe thys contrarye senate beeyng greeued wyth euidently seene accused first ambition appoynted prouinces brutus cassius syria macedonia whyche full greate armyes least shoulde seeme make hast theyr tyme gaue pretence prouide grayne citie wherefore greater feare dyd yet trouble lacke appoynted armye menne naked syghte wyth manye well armed fellowe beeyng man suspected disagreeyng one conspirator agaynste caesar appoynted bee heere daye hys deathe thyngs beeyng great trouble seekyng speede disarme oure enimies arme oure selues kylled amatius thoughte good call home pompey thys meane mighte ioyne senate agayne yet much trustyng persuaded dolobelia aske syria senate people lawe bee made hys sute furthered hym friende make hym enimie striker shoulde seeme verye vnfytte senate denye macedonia seeyng hadde graunted syria dolobella otherwise woulde haue graunted mee prouince delyuered armye excepte hadde firste graunted dolabella goe agaynste parthian woulde haue taken brutus cassius syria macedonia vnlesse hadde appoynted prouinces theyr suretie needes must appoynte one another manner one cyrene creta voyde army whyche oure enimies contempte haue lefte vnprofitable violence haue entred whyche wee tooke thus oure armye putte oure enimies dolabella deuice sleighte exchange prouinces warre must thinges bee done lawe beeyng thus broughte passe oure enimies gathering another armye hadde neede selfe macedonia yet wanted occasion require fame came getes woulde inuade macedonia whyche beeyng beleeued espies sente vnderstande truth decreed man ought aske dictatorshippe take though gyuen hym whych thyng beeyng chiefly allured appoynted armye dyd thinke selfe equall mine enimies euidente octauius thynketh moe number greater power yet appearing done one striker remayned still hard side decimus brutus beeyng gouernoure greate countrey mighty armye verye bolde deuised take hys prouince hym yet wyth regarde senate promising delyuer macedonia voyde armye senate takyng thyng euill perceyuing deuice bee hadde howe greate matter written decimus knowe stirre consulles agaynste mee wherefore wyth boldenesse dyd practise wynne prouince senate people lawe haue armye macedonia come brund vse oportunities god help vse necessitie shall compell v thus muche feare wherein first turned safetie haue doe wyth v boldnesse agaynste oure foe whose courage beginnes shrinke increase see repentance make decree payne mee take france gyuen another man knowe wrote decimus persuaded consul agaynste matter wyth god oure countrey wyth dutifull mynde wyth oure valiante actes whyche caesar conqueroure wee wyll reuenge labouring bodyes counselling wyth oure mynds thyngs souldioure fellowes woulde haue secrete although howe haue done haue tolde whome participate thyngs worde deede may shewe knowe onely octauius except vnthankefull v antony hadde thus saide seemed captaynes done thing great art policie deceiue quellers whome hated therefore desirous reconcile caesar agayne persuaded meete capitoll long antony cause gard apprehended friendes entised octauius destroy himnevv despight antony caesar eyther discredite octauius thoughte true learning sente hys campe declared done coniecture dispatche hys person whiche matter beeyng quietly heard caused muche adoe indignation among people fewe grounded vppon reason glad antony myghte doe caesar good also hurte hys pleasure bycause hee terrible striker hee dispatched myghte wyth securitie doe theyr feates bycause senate chiefly fauoured thus wyser sorte thinke multitude seeyng despight hynderance dayly offered octauius thoughte vnlike calumniation yet supposed good honest antony beyng consull shoulde bee daunger hys person octauius caesar greate anger furie wente among thys opinion cryed hee circumuented antony frendshyppe onely people ranne antonyes house exclaymed caesar exclaymeth agaynste antony called god witnesse execration othes prouoking hym come tryall bycause bodye came hym sayde hys friendes contente bee iudged hys owne people brake dores beeyng kepte backe sware rebuked kepte gate bycause stopped hym making tryall wyth antony wente hys way protested people hurte came vnto hym shoulde come antonyes meanes hauyng spoken greate vehemencie greeued people repented theyr former opinion stoode doubte usted neyther thoughte dissimulation betweene better bryng passe agreed vpon temple againste enimies thought antonie deuised haue greater garrison turne men good octauius nowe secrete intelligence gyuen hym antonyes armye brunduse discontented armye brunduse ordinarie souldioures angrye antonie bycause neglected caesar death woulde reuenge power antonie gone hast brunduse cause octauius afrayde least returning antonyes goyng brunduse suspected caesar armye shoulde finde hym vnprouided tooke mony wente campania winne city inhabited serued father first persuaded celatia silio two townes capua gaue euerie octauius goeth make men celatia latio silio ca ilinum campania farre capua feare citie man fiue hundred drammes tenne thousande menne neyther armed distributed due band order gard person vnder one ensigne citie afrayde antony commyng army heard octauius comming another double feare tooke well mighte vse octauius antony sawe theyr reconciliation capitoll thought dissimulation recompence one authoritie persecute quellers thys disquietnesse carnutiw tribune enimie antony friende octauius wente knowe truth whyche beeyng done hee declared people playne variance betweene antony octauius stoode hande make octauius theyr friende seeyng none armye resist antonyes tyrannie sayde tribune yo casar antony thus willed octauius enter lay little withoute citie temple mar hee dyd came temple iupiters chyldren whyche souloioures stoode theyr weapon openly carnutius spake firste antony octauius hymselfe reuiued memorie hys father shewed iniurie antony hadde done hym octauius people whereby forced gette armye hys suretie wyth whyche woulde obey serue countrey thyngs nowe readye agaynste antonie hadde thus sayde counsell broken vp armye thoughte otherwyse bycause theyr reconciliation onely broughte preserue octauius person agaynste hys quellers seemed bee greeued suche wordes shoulde bee spoken agaynste antonie beeyng generall armye consull citie desired goe home arme themselues coulde abyde none theyr owne army tolde truth octauius army goeth octauius beganne doubt agayne seeyng came otherwyse passe thought therefore gaue place occasion trustyng wynne rather gentlenesse giueth souldyoures force wherefore sente bee armed theyr home agayne promising theyr laboures hydyng hys griefe gaue newe giftes promised liberally requite woulde vse hys enterprise rather hys father friendes hys souldioures hadde sayde one thousande three thys writer vary wanne tarrie rest wente awaye remembryng toyle tyllage gayne warfare wordes caesar easilie dyd drawe giftes hadde receyued hope shoulde receyue variable nature people beganne repent turning occasion dutie armed themselues returned went rauenna octauius armye returneth ar uum citie tuscane thirty myles florence reuenue hadde gone ouer countrey gotten menne one another sente arezz meane time fiue legion macedonie foure come antonie brunduse accusing one neglected caesar deathe bycause gaue greetyng hym broughte hym hys seate heare somewhat firste sayde themselues offended silence antony offended vvith souldioures coulde refrayne rebuked vnthankefulnesse hym called iourney parthia remayne italie acknowledge anye thankea mutiny antonyes camp blamed bearing rashe yong man called caesar woulde discouer hym suche person sente make difference betweene woulde fynde hymselfe intendyng leade wealthie prouince celtica gyue euery one woulde abide hym one hundred drammes souldyoures laught miserable offer morethe souldyoures laught miserie antony angry disorder tumulte wherefore rose sayde shall learne ruled enquired chiefetaynes seditious among romaine vsed note euerye manne writing lawe warre chose hee dyd kyll euery tenth manne parte thinking fewe affray rest feare rather anger hate tourned doings whiche thyng perceyued sente thyther octauius threwe billes aboute campe conteyning niggardnesse crueltie antonie vnthankefulnesset ng caesar dead liberalitie gentlenesse might help antonie great diligence soughte author threatning greate payne dyd disclose coulde finde anye hee muche offended whole army fauoure hearde extraordinarie band gone caesar octauius done rome troubled came agayne army sayde greeue doe done necessitie souldious discipline taking stead many according lawe antony souldyoures well knowe antonie neyther cruell sparing quoth let anger go let ynough punishment offence hundred drammes meante gifte antony fortune requyred otherwyse welcome fyrste acquayntance betweene rather gifte hee wylled haue lawe countrey souldyoures order oughte bee obediente hym thys thyngs thus sayd yet dyd adde anye somme least captayne shoulde seeme giue place souldioure eyther repentance feare accepted hee changed officer hys campe eyther displeasure thys sedition suspition rest suche furniture deuiding host sent sea arimeno takyng one bande likely men bodye obedience wente towarde rome thence goe also arimeno arimeno hee proudely entred citie leauyng one bande withoute citie campe wyth aboute hym armed hee caused hys house bee garded nyghte hys safetie whome gaue watchwordes dyuers part garrison citie assembled senate intending haue accused octauius doings entry tolde martiall legion way gone octauius hee stoode doubt feare whattvvo legion reuolte octauius fro antony doe also shewed hym fourthe legion following martial example likewise reuolted octauius much troubled entred made shew called senate purpose tarried long went gate thence cittie alba stay reuolters put walles hee retourned legion hee sente fiue hundred dram tibur novv uol man hadde hee wente tiburo hauyng suche prouision bee wonte goe agaynst theyr enimies nowe euident warre woulde followe decimus meante leaue hys prouince antony beeyng thys place almoste senate manye gentleman came hym honor dyd great part people synding hym gyuyng othe hys souldiors presente hadde serued beefore whyche resorted hym greate number freely sware antony woulde breakethe senatoures citizen svvorne antony faith beneuolence wyth hym nowe man mighte doubte little hadde spoken againste antony octauius caesar sake antony thus wyth great pompe approched arimeno beginning fraunce cel ca armye beside newe souldioures three legion macedonia nowe come vnto hym olde souldioures serued counted twice good yong hadde antony armye foure legion experte antony armye souldioures beside suche bee wonte followe venturer olde guarde hys person wyth n chosen lepidus iberia hadde three legion asinius pollio twoolepidus asinius pollio plancus plancus fraunce three whyche seemed take antony parte octauius octauius caesar twoo choise legion wente antony one yog souldiors two serued first neyther full number furnished armoure yet supplyed newe commers gathered togither alba sent senate dydde muche reioice octauius man myghte doubte anye dydde honoure antony yet theythe senate mistaked octauius u antony bothe content legion went hym shoulde goe octauius neuerthelesse praysed caesar promising shortly determine decree bee doonc newe magistrate hadde theyr office euident ende woulde bend antony bycause army coulde gather none wythout consul auctoritie deferred till newe election caesar army offred mace sergeant prepared prayed take vpon hym lieutenantship leading warre euer vsed auctoritie thanked honoure referred matter senate wolde haue gone heap purpose forbad staied would haue sent ambassadours senate quoth hee maye take order themselues vnderstanding offer refusall hardly beeyng contented waye capitaines construing men suspition declared vnto senate dyd rather encline good feare antony want army til quoth haue dispatched antony murtherers friend kinsemen senate wil gather power whych perceyuing wil pretend obey disclosed take power vppon v call violence contumelic wee make daunger peraduenture giue v fearing otherwise wee shal haue hee hadde thus sayde hee sawe twoo legious came antony shewing shape battaylea fight tvvoo legion contending together vehement wise thoughe hadde beene fighting indeede kylling onely excepted hee beeing delighted feate glad take occasion didde gyue euery man fiue hundred drammes anye necessitye warre shoulde followe hee promised hauing better hande fyue thousande drammes man thus caesar liberalitie rewarde winne hys hyred menne dooyngs italy fraunce antony commaunded decimus go macedonia antony vvarneth decimus oute prouince obey people saue himselfe decimus sente letter senate verye well written signifying well oughte hee obey senate people antony appoynted hym daye hee woulde vse hym enimie decimus required hym appoynt longer daye hymselfe hee shoulde soone made enimye senate antony good hym fielde yet thoughte better goe vnto city receyued hym decimus beeyng afrayde hee shoulde hee would enter anye fayned hadde receyued letter senate returne rome wyth hys army one goyng home italy receiued euery place came mutina plentifull citie shutte mutina citie lumbar rovv modena decimus taketh modena hys defence gate commaunded citizen bring thynges foorthe necessarye foode caused al beast kylled poudred feare siege woulde laste long tarryed antony comming hys armye number swordeplayers three legion armed whereof one new souldiours withoute experience two former seruice faithfull hym antony anger came againste decimus caste trenche aboute cittie decimus besieged rome consul according yeare chosen dydde straighte assemble senate sacrifice temple agaynste antony cicero friend require might iudged enimie cicero againste antony bycause force armes didde take prouince france contrarie senats pleasure trouble hys countrey bycause brought army italie appoynted hym againste thracian alleadged also againste hym caesar sought rule armed citie many bandleader vsing house forte full souldiours ensign hys dooyngs insolent became yearely officer lucius piso one fauoured antony faction man lucius piso againste cicero verye notable among romaynes fauoured piso antony cause required hee myghte bee called iudgement bycause manner theyr countrey condemne anye manne hee hearde conuenient hee yesterdaye consull thys daye enimy especially hauing bene ofte praysed bothe cicero senate stoode doubtfull cause nightsenate againste antony nexte day morning beeyng agayne assembled ciceronians wyth greate instaunce hadde decreede antony ennimye hadde saluius tribune dissolued counsell till nexte daye office hee hathe moste power maye prohibite ciceronians dydde spitefully laboure againste hym ad ra againste antony ranne among people styrre vppon hym cited saluius aunswere wythoute feare came foorthe till thesaluius senate stayed hym fearing leaste incense people drawe memorye antonie ignoraunte condemned noble manne wythout iudgement people gyuen hym france feare strykers angry hym bycause first brake lawe obliuion therefore chose octauius agaynst ignoraunt therof desirous dispatch antony senate thus affected voyces notwithstanding deferred tribune yet determined decimus shoulde praysed giue place antonie celtica caesar consul hircius pansa ioyne army image gold made honour might giue voyce among senatours allowed consullhonours giuen octanius ten yeares lawe legion went antony shoulde haue muche giuen treasure caesar appointed victorie decreed brake vp euen already antony enemy deede tribune daring speake next daye wherefore wife hys mother wyth sonne yet yong friendes familiar night went great men house beseech next daye came senate house suing euerye man falling feete weeping wayling blacke habite cryed counsel dore lamentable voyces behauiour sodennesse matter moued compassion wherefore cicero afrayde spake thus vnto senate ought decree antony yesterday determine cicero antony gaue honour aduersaries co demned enimie saluius impediment v eyther thinketh himselfe wise friendship beareth antony ignorace matter euerye one great shame al haue lesse wit one also saluius prefer friendship comon wealth whe hath well vnderstand present case haue giuen credite consul pretor tribune fellowes senatoures number worthinesse manye oure age experience oughte knowe antonie better salu publique cause iudgementes parte euer hath right cause muste vee knowne nowe learned agayne wyll repeate briefelye touche moste principall matter caesar deade antony tooke awaye oure common money rule macedonia hadde v fraunce entred violently without v army delyuered hym againste thracian hee brought italie againste v requiring deceitfully v obtayning hee himselfe brunduse ordained princelye bande aboute hym openlye rome men armour dyd guarde watche hym vnder ensignes broughte brunduse armye cittie readye attemptes aspiring thing caesar hee lamented coueted yong caesar prepared againste hym another armye hee afrayde wente fraunce place fittest vse force againste v bycause caesar place inuade v got rule ouer v giuing terrour armye mighte sticke hys vnlawfull dooyngs lotte hee caused dye neither making anye mutinie forsaking charge order battell whiche onelye lawe armes thinke hath appoynted punishemente whyche fewe capitaynes scarcelye greate perills woulde vse necessitie hee worde ieste giueth death citizen death deserue suche woulde choose wherefore coulde haue forsaken hym yesterdaye dyd determine rewarde hadde doone well coulde escape awaye feare doe dwell enimies inuade youre lande besiege youre armye youre generall appoynted remaine fraunce antony commaundeth hym departe whether haue iudged antony ennimye doeth hee vse v enimyes oure tribune wyll know tyll decimus deade tyll prouince greate nygh vnto v prouince armye also decimus maye antony power worke hys hope agaynste v lyke tribune wyll soone decree hym ennimye tyll hee bee lorde ouer v whyle cicero thus saying hys friendes made greate noyse continuallye woulde suffer anye manne speake agayne tyll piso rose vppe senate reuerence commaunded silence ciceronians stayde piso thus beganne speake lawe senatours doth allowe accused topiso haue hys cause heard hath aunswered himselfe iudged accordynglye cicero moste vehement oratoure doe chalenge durste accuse antony presente hys absence hath layde greate matter charge greatest doubtfullest whereof wyll note wyth shorte aunswere shewe bee false hee sayeth antony caesar deathe dyd take publique money hys owne lawe calleth suche one theefe enimye appointyng payne therefore brutus hadde slayne caesar accused hym people spoyling common money leauing te nothyng antony decree matter searched approued hys sentence publique appointyng rewarde tenthe woulde declare whych wyll double man accuse antony thus much concerning money prouince fraunce appoint antony people lawe cicero present sort manye giuen heretofore gaue caesar like maner part decree antony make warre vpon decimus would giue place vnto army prepared thracian stirreth shoulde led resisted cicero doth iudge decimus enemye maketh warre againste lawe antony obeyeth lawe condemneth hym hee condemneth made lawe whome hee ought persuasion pacific prouoke contumelie neither ought credite place decimus people haue bannished murder discredite antony people haue giuen law good counsel make diuision people especially daugerous time forget belongeth chiefly people iudge friendes foe auntient lawes people lord war peace whiche time notwithstanding haue appointed commaunded vsed priuiledge ouer v saith antony killed certain souldiours general appointed therevnto neuer captaine generall charged wyth office lawes haue thought meete captaine subiect souldiours nothing worse campe disobedience whiche conquerours haue bene ouerthrowen none punished haue complayned none friendes kinsfolke cicero hath accused finding fault death instead honor hath ben wont giuen executers wil haue antony exclaymed enimy antony army disordered dis ayned hym en det two legion fled fro comanded serue vnder contrary law souldiers haue fled fro octa caesar cicero prayseth also yesterday would haue rewarded commo treasure whiche example pray god one daye repent suche inconuenience hath enmity caried cicero accuseth antony tyranny also murder souldiours wheras seeke mischiefe country euer please army punish bycause accuse antony none matter tiranny caesar rule go wil aske question euery thing hath antony killed vnharde tyrant selfe vnhard daunger condemned whome hath vanished hath cast hath bin euery particular man hathe layde traynes v cicero decreed forgetfulnesse thing done man shoulde prosecute murder search shoulde made common treasure called home pompey pompeis sonne wished might recompenced common father substaunce dispatched counterfayte marius al praysed cicero disprayse determined dictator created spoken ordayned would shoulde dye thing antony v two monethes alone remayned cittie caesar people pursewed sticker afrayde thing come woulde haue taken occasion haue bene vmust coulde haue better yet hee dyd vse hys power contrary alone rule dolobella gone syria dyd vse hys army preste al purpose citie whyche appointed hym watch citie garded night feare enimies occasio caesar death friend benefactour deare people another nere whe body laid neyther banished put death rather fauoured much reaso honesty coulde enuying see romaine greatest doubtful matter cicero hathg athered hys accusation ioyneth deuination thoughe antony woulde haue broughte greate armye againste cittie hee afrayde octauius caesar preuented hym wyth armye entende onely bee parte manne ennimye doeth hee counte hym one came encamped cittye gaue warnyng antony woulde come howe hapte hee came hee afrayde caesar three thousande vnarmed hauyng thirtye thousand well armed came onely caesar helpe pacifycation betweene saw warre would follow forsooke hym afrayde hee thyrtie thousande howe came hither one thousande whyche goyng tibure howe manye dyd wee sende vnto hym howe manye v wente bee sworne hym sworne prayses dyd cicero make hys good gouernemente vertue howe woulde antony hee hadde knowen thys haue lefte wyth v pledge nowe bee without senate house hys mother hys wife hys young sonne whyche lamente feare nowe antony doyngs common wealthe hys ennimyes power thys haue rehearsed vnto example antony innocencye cicero mutabilitye well wyll consyder wyll giue thys exhortation neyther charge people antony neyther bring generall enimetie daunger common wealthe beyng sickely wantyng speed c might relieue make cyttie strong abroade doe styrre anye tumulte whereby wee maye resiste anye wyll ryse againste v ge wee shall thinke good performe wee haue iudged howe thys bee done wee suffer antony loue fauour people haue fraunce wee call home decimus wyth hys three legion hee come sen e hym macedonia retayning hys legion calling two legion wente antony wee doe require cicero sayeth caesar bee citie hauyng fiue legion wee maye confyrme wee decree driuen hang anye man hope thys haue spoken hearer without enuye emulation inconsiderately vnaduisedly seeke trouble priuate grudge displeasure shall beseeche judge bee quicke swifte againste greate men leader mightye armyes doe force make warre againste wyli remembryng marcus coriolanus late caesar bringing armye likewise offring verye good condition concorde wee rashelye condemned enimye necessitie made bee indeede let v beare wyth people earst stirre againste strykers caesar seeme hys reproch giue prouinces nation prayse decimus bycause hee despiseth people lawe condemne antony bycause hee receyueth fraunce people order behoueth bee good iudgement redresse goe astraye consul tribune prouide daungers present state thus dyd piso speake defence cry sharpe wordes onlye cause antony iudged rebell yet coulde obtayne hee shoulde haue prouince frenche celtica friendes kinsefolke killer feare lette leaste warre shoulde ceasse hee bee one octauius reuenge caesar deathe wherefore theyr practise deuise kepe antony octauius styll debate decreed antony receiue macedonie stead lombardie al order eyther ignoraunce purpose committed cicero appoint giue answere embassadours hauing sentence dyd thus determyne antony shoulde streight departe modena andthe decree cuer amony leaue celtica decimo within compasse floud rubicone diuideth italie lombardie daye prefixed committe matter senate thus cicero ambitiously vniustly dyd appointe determination anye great priuate enmitie shoulde seeme destinye determined trouble state mutation bring himselfe euill happe ende instante come broughte ash trebonius despight vsed throughly knowne senate easilye decree dolabella bee rebell dolabella declared rebel messenger come antony ashamed strange commission sayd nothing deliuered decree vnto great anger ueigh senate cicero maruelling would thinkethe ansvvere antony decree caesar tyranne king muche augmented state rome accompte cicero whome caesar toke warre yet kill whereas cicero doeth preferre hys killer friendes hated decimus trusty caesar loued euer since killer would ayde caesar kept celtica iudge hym rebell people legion assigned decree reuolted senate giueth rewarde none remayne duety corrupt quoth discipline war belonging citie quellers could graunt obliuion facte whiche consente two noble mennes sake antonye dolobella hee iudgeth enimyes bycause wee keepe giuen v verye cause antony senate leaue celtica neither enimy tyranne protest dissolue forgetfulnesse shall verye acceptable hym many thing sorte spake antony wrote thys antony cicero aunswere decree senate woulde obey hys countrey cicero wrote commaundement thus spake people haue giuen celtica lawe decimus wil obey remoue reuenge matter murther hym senate may purged aulte antony conde ned whereof ful ciceroes sake helpe decimus antony thus saide wrote wherefore senate iudged hym enimy armye vnlesse wente hym macedonia illiria army appointedthe povver marcus brutus asia macedonia slauonia marcus brutus till common wealth brought better state armye hys owne receyued one appuleius shippes bothe gallies hulkes sixteen thousand talent money greate plenty armour founde citie demeatride layde vp caesar demeatride tovvne thes salie vvas called pagasa novve demeatrida syria appoynted cassius whiche senate confirmed decree hee mighte vse benefit hys country syria senate appoynted cassius commaunded make warre vppon dolobella prouinces army romaine ionian sea easte charged obey brutus cassius wherefore cassius brutus estate sodainely great fame octauius caesar vnderstoode thynges hee doubt thought lawe obliuion proceede conueniecie humanitie respect pitie kinsfolke men like aucthoritie therfore appointed prouinces shorte tyme securitie celtica decimus note antony tyranny deuice induce hym againste antony nowe dolobella condemned rebell killing one quellers mightye nation giuen prouince erutus cassius manye army wyth greate speedin ie appointed abundaunce money made generalles people ionia india perce ued tended aduauncement pompey parte vtter destruction caesar senate wente aboute deceyue hym youngman plotte wherof conceiued mynd wasvvhen hey made capitaine antony meant take armye consulls fielde neede capitayne onely honour gyuen souldiours reuolted antony hys vnhonoured warre would worke infamy ng vsed none intent senate destruction antony kept consideration secrete hymselfe mak ng sacrifice charge gyuen hym thus sayd hys armye honour fellow souldiours may thanke souldiours onelye nowe tyme gaue mee power sake senate haue gyuen therfore also know youre debtor thankes whiche god shall gyue v god lucke requite abundantly thus speake win e hys armye marched foorth pansa one consul lead army ouer italy hirtius consull diuided caesar secretely instructed senate required di ision two legion went antony bycause counted best souldiors caesar grant euery thing diuided encamped togither wynter ende winter decimus beganne lacke victual wherefore hirtius caesar wente mutina antony one italy shoulde get decimus armye opprest famine antony holding mutina straighte force woulde fight hym tarried pansa diuers skirmish made whyche thoughe antony hadde greater number horse yet narrownesse fielde ditch riuers keepe backe multitude horseman thus went matter mutina rome absence consul cicero dydde al cicero rule h rome people ruler assembled senate euerye daye hee made prouision armour compelling workemen without payment gathered money putte great imposition vppon antony friendes suffered patiently auoide displeasure til publius ventidius serued vnder caesar friende ventidius maketh rome afraid cicero flee antony could abide sharpenesse cicero wente caesar habitation well knowne gotte twoo legion whyche ledde antonie rome take cicero great trouble grew insomuche manye wente awaye wyth wiues child feare cicero cicero fleeth fledde oute cittie whyche ventidius knewe hee tourned straighte antony stepte caesar hirtius la ca de ancona coutry ancona hee wente picene gathered another legion stayed see would come consull caesar seeing pansa drew nighe hys hoste sente car leius leader caesar chiefe bande andcarsuleius martiall legion helpe passe straight antonie dydde muche care passage mightethe stratage antony otherwise hinder desirous ight could vse horseman playne bycause fenny place full ditch hidde twoo hys beste legion fenne waye beeing made hande straighte side couered reedes carsuleius nighte passing hys place breake day come way made hand martialls souldioures fyue bandes wente vppon made way cleare ennimyes beholde fenne euerye syde sawe stirring reedes glittering terg t headpeeces began suspect chiefe band antony sodainelye appeared afore martiall legion side beset hauing roomth shifte abroad forbad newe souldiours take anye paine wyth leaste lacke experience shoulde trouble placed caesar thiefe bande againste antony diuiding themselues twoo encountred bothe legion pansa capitaine one parte notable fighte martiall legion againste tvvo antony tvvo chiefe handes antony octauius battell declared tenth booke hys ep stles car leius bycause two fen two fight bycause straight place one could see vppon verye waye two chiefe bandes beganne another fight betweene themselues antony men entended reuenged martialls bycause fugitiues vse traytoures martialls woulde bee reuenged suspected theyr fellowes deathes unduse beeyng thus priuie one anothers doings strength eyther armye hoped thys onely feate warre woulde determined one ashamed two legion shoulde ouercome one sought glorye one legion shoulde defeate two ioyned battel anger emulation rather themselues capitaynes trying owne matter experience neyther made crie though stroken one another fight vttered anye voyce neither better worse fetched compasse course stoode firme fennes ditch could one put another backe shorte sword clasped togither wrestling place blowe giuen vaine either woundes slaughter followed sighes steede voice fell straight another putte hys place neede exhortation calling euerye man owne experience captayne hymselfe ouerlaboured woulde staye take breath men place exercise straighte close agayne young souldiours stoode maze see thys feate doone good order silence continuing beyond man nature chiefe band caesar slaine martialls vnder carsuleius hadde rather vpper hande enimies disorderedly ray withdrew selues vnder pansa dyd abide equally stoode bothe side till pansa wounded darte belly caried pansa bononia firste retyred order turned swiftely flying yong souldiours sawe fled confusion crie campe torquatus pretor prouided whyles fightyng foreseeing neede whiche new souldiours ran great violence beyng italian well martial exercise maketh one nation much differ vertueexercise martial dyd enter trench dishonour stoode weary though remayned ready resist assaulte abide ende matter antony dyd touche martialles bycause knewe valiant young souldiours chased made greate slaughter among hirtius mutina hearyng fight beyng aboute eyghthirtius myles distant came baste legion fled antony sunne goyng downe antony souldiours hauing victory went singing camp hirtius appeared beyng good order one legionthe fight vvith hirtius men sounde valiante order wherefore necessitie placed themselues due sort shewed many valiant noble feates although coragious yet beyng weary ouercome freshe parte slayne hirtius feate albeit folow feare fennes night comming u rth ovven seuer fenne place filled harnesse dead men half dead wounded safe dispaired themselues wearinesse horsementhe horse men antony antony rode al night gathered togither caried themselues brought home horsebacke badde take holde horse tayle goe faster seeke saue themselues thus antony hauyng fought nobly loste force commyng hirtius wherefore abode village fielde without campe village called french market halfe eyther syde t slayne c r bande person vtterly destroyed hirti souldioures left nexte morning remoued camp mutina losse antony determined giue battell hys enimies admitte attempt horseman molest daye day till gotten decimus yeelde driuen hunger cause hirtius caesar rather prouoked hym fight whereas perceyue antony woulde come forth keepyng men order went side citie whych bicause harder approch lesse kept whole army myght enter force antony made resistance horseman put backe horse army passing would antony afraid citie brought forth two legious glad thys retired foughte whilest antony campes sent legion troubled time greate suddayne attempt whiche long comming caesar men ouerthrew antony fight hirtius droue antony campe fighting manfully antony tente slayn whose body caesar louing great speed recouered ay gote campe till shortlye hee repulsed antony watched night armoure antony fallen seconde losse streighte battell called hys friend counsell thought according former meaning keepe still ge dena come anye fight loss like hirtius slayne pansa hurte horseman better mutina broughte extreame want must needes shortly giue ouer thus friend thoughte good best indede antoni god striking afraide least caesar shoulde proceede obteyning citie day making walles entrenche hym hauing many pioners purpose horse good said lepidus plancus wil despite one ouercome goe fro modena tidius wil streight come v three legion march strong lepidus pl ncus take part thus said man afrayde peril leuyed seege went straight toward alpes decimus delyuered seege began feare caesar enimie bycause consul gone wherefore make bridge riuer day sent acknowledging hymde author safetie prayed hauing floude betwixte woulde come talke witnesse citizen would let vnderstand wicked fortune forced conspire caesar thereto driuen octauius angerly aunswered messenger refusing thankes decimus gaue quoth came saue octauius aunsvvere cimus decimus ouerthrow antonie whome reconcyled reason come speech fighte decimus nature abhorred let therefore keepe himselfe long shall seeme citie decimus heard farre floud called caesar name loude voyce redde vnto senate letter giuen prouince celtica forbad also caesar without consul shoulde passe bridge others prouince follow antonie able ynough octauius seeyng boldnesse senate mighte commission haue taken hee spared wente bononia pansa whence wrote senate thing pa whose letter cicero th e ly n reade people rome consull caesar redde senate onely decreed generall procession fiftie dayes agaynste antonie like whereof done romaine neyther warre fraunce none battayle consulles armyes appoynted decimus pansa beeyng yet aliue lyke scape decimus made generall decimus made generall alone agaynste antonie publike prayer made decimus myghte ouercome antonie greate hate displeasure growen agaynste antonie two legion fledde antony confirmed euery souldiour accordyng former promise fiue thousand ammes common treasure souldiours conquest graunted solemne feastes weare crowne ue leaues octauius nothing mentioned much name soone dyd contemne though antony bene vtterly destroyed wrote also lept cu asinius fight antony gh hym done rome pansa beyng poynt death reason wounde said thus caesar sittyng friende thy father selfe whome coulde eage beyng slayne able resiste many whome thou also haste done wisely obey although thou haddest armie firste fearyng thee antony manne moste ambitious enclinyng towarde caesar sentence haue bene content suffer variance consume selues sawe thou wast lorde army iyong man set thee foorth countenance slender honour thou wast stronger estimation thou wouldest recerue autoritie vnder army gaue thee troubled appoynted thee ioyne v wee mighte take thee twoo legion moste practised hopyng ouercome alone shoulde weaker hym destroy al caesar friendes set vp pompey summe determination hirtius haue done co mission represse antony grewe suspition ouercome wae thought beste thee one doyng thee benefite remembraunce caesar amitie onely whiche supposed thy felicitie tyme come afore time haue giuen thee consell benefitte nowe antony broken hirtius dead like liue oportunitie serueth speake thou shouldest thanke dead thou beyng borne great felicitie thy deedes shewe mightest knowe beste thee chayse destiny hirtius mee armye thou gauest v thinke fitte gyue thee agayne yong souldyoures thou couldest keepe would also giue thee would much offende senate bycause officer sent keeper v would worke th enu e put thee trouble needes therefore torquatus pretor shall haue thus sayd deliuered torquatus dyed pansa consul dyeth senate commaunded sent decimus caesar deliuered hirtius pansa funerall greate honor andthe consul buryed honourably sent rome great shew syria macedonia time diuers thing happened iulius caesar passed syria left legion myndingcecilius bassus go parthian cecilius bassus charge thereof iulius sextus yong man allyed caesar theiulius sextus dignitie ledde legion without order delitious licentious life bassus reproued vsed wyth despightefulnesse bassus againe calling grudgingthe mutiny army syria commaunded force broughte whe tumult fray made army bearing inlius kylled despighte killed iulius whereof streighte repented feare caesar making oth one another vnlesse forgiuenesse faith giuen woulde fyght deathe compelling bassus oth gathered another legion trayned exercise thus write bassus libo writeth bassus pompey parte battayle liued priuately tyro corrupte legion killed sextus obeyed bassus howsoeuer matter wente valiantly resisted sextius murcus sente caesar three legion till murcus sextius murcus minutius crispus bythinia asia lesse nexte troy ca ius obteyned legion call minutius crassus ruler bythinia came ayde three legion bassus beseeged cassius came great hast receyued two legion bassus also wanne fire legion beseeged friendship obeyed vnderconsul sayd decreed obey cassius brutus albienus time sente lobella aegipt albienus brought thence foure legion whiche scattered ouerthrowe crassus pompey else lefte caesar wyth cleopatra cassius comming suddaynely vpon hym compelled deliuer legion palestina afrayd foure legion palestina nexte india arabia fighte eyghte cassius beyonde expectation lord twelue full legion dolobella going asia cassius lord tvvelue legion dicea noble citie asia igh ond u liodicea frendship receyued followed beseeged whiche thyng senate hearde glad macedonia caius antonius brother antonius marcus dyd make warre brutus hauing one legion armed citizen inferioure brutus layde traynes hym brutus escaping catch like traynes nothing taken badde owne souldioures familiar enimies refusing familiaritie admitting conu rsation suffered freely departe advantage goyng another way appeared suddaynely vnto another straight dyd touche p u getteth legion macedonia gently receyued remembring euer thought courteous citizen worthy opinion wisedome mildenesse accepted hys courtesie gaue themselues vnto caius also yeelded hym honor brutus till founde manye brutus ge le time corruptyng army put away thus brutus former army syxe legion praysing macedonian gathered two legion whome exercised italian manner thyngs done siria macedonia itali caesar tooke euill decimus made generall agaynste antonie hidde hys anger octa u desireth triumph senate denyeth triumph desired hee myghte make triumph feates hee hadde done beeing reiected senate requiring greater thynges belonged hys age hee afraide least antonie ouerthrowen woulde despise therefore desired haue conference hym pansa counselled hym hee dyed souldioures captaynes antony taken hee vsed courteously tooke hys owne caesar vseth antonyes souldioures vvell woulde sente antonie signification enimie hym ventidius friend antonie hadde broughte three legion drewe nygh wyth hys army octa ius caesar practi eth vvith ventidius antonyes friende made hym afrayde nothing hym graunted hym eyther ioyne hym goe antonie freely hys armie protest lacke knowledge mitted common profite ventidius heard thys wente antonie meane tyme octauius caesar honoured decius one antony captaynes whome hee hadde taken mutina gaue hym leaue go antonie woulde octauius saying decius captayne antonyes demaunding hys mynde towarde antonie hee sayde shewed sufficiente manye token coulde perc yue woulde ignorante woulde suffice thus dyd caesar signifye antonie le idus asinius playnely signifyed despight hym myghtie preparation kyllers octauius dealeth vvith iepidus asinius makyng afrayde increase pompeis faction caesar friendes one another shoulde serued antonie whych ignoraunce suspition feare longer suffer allowed well shoulde obey senate octauius pra e vvith antonyes friend fashion theyr owne suretie shoulde agree togyther whylest myghte shoulde heerein reprooue antony vse manner legionary departe seruice done leaue trade warre disseuer leaste thereby enimie myghte take aduantage rather togither inhabite others place thereto desirous power seuerally euery man countrey consume owne caesar send lepidus asinius deci u armye olde famished full sicknesse loosenesse bodye decimus army ger plenty plancus oyneth vvith decimus newe souldioures yet vnexercised plancus ordinarie armye drew nigh vnto decimus wrote senate antonie shoulde caught snare beeing tyred thing past p mpeys friend hearing maruellously reioyce cry time restore countreys libertie euerye man made sacrifice elected tenne men punishe antony creation tenne men rome power forme abolish caesar decree whiche antonie put vre remembrance little nothing himselfe whiche thing senate well perceyuing occasion disanull hoped dissolue tenne men commaund whosoeuer hadde receyued anye di tenne men thing antony authoritie contrarye senate restore declare disobeyed punishment threatned pompey secte required rule consul stead hirtius pansa rest yeare caesar like senate cicero priuately sendyng octa ius requireth consull vvith cicero exhorting office bycause sage experte better acquainted office would thinke benefyte beare name might haue honest pretence leaue armye cause required triumph cicero heereby blowen vp ambition sayde perceyuedthe ambition cicero conspiracie wrought captaynes abroade therefore thought good pleasure yong man beeyng well intreated lorde greate armye rather graunte office citie time force armes least might something content senate wished wise antients might appoynted maister yong yeares senate laughed cicero ambition kinsman killer cicero laughed earing caesar would accuse consull diuerse lawfull cause made delay election antonie tyme passed mountaines hauing persuaded culeo suffereth antony passe mountaines culeo capitaine lepidus keper passage credite hym drewe nighe ioude lepidus lay without trenche ditche bicause would shew friend diuerse message sent betweene antony recording diuers friendshippes pleasure affirmed hepract se betvvene antony lepidus woulde agree caesar shoulde broughte like calamitie lepidus afraide senate hadde commaunded hym make warre vppon anto affyrmed yet againste lepidus army reuer cing dignitie antonie perceiuing messenger betweene delighting quietnesse souldiours secretly firste mingled among openly fellow citizen souldiors forbidden captain making accompte commaundemente made bridge boat ouer riuer mighte better comethe tenth legio beganne reuo te lepidus laterensis togither legion called tenth sometime wont bee led antonie prepared ten laterensis one noble senatoures perceyuing thys opened matter lepidus giuing credite hym willed armye bee diuided diuerse partes sent diuers v trie treason faith lepidus deuided three commaunded night shoulde conduct treasourer armye comming lepidus souldioures let antony hand passing last watch arming themselues iorney went strongest parte campe opened gate antony ranne lepidus tentes armye bringing hym praying lepidus mercie peace afflicted citizen lepidus leapte oute hys antony lepidus ag ee bed without clothes promysed embracing antony excused necessitie saye dydde kneele antonie one cowarde small experience whyche writer allowe thinke probable hee hadde done parte athe greate povver againe ennimye againste antony whereby bee asrayde hym thus antony risen agayne greate power beecame moste fearefull vnto ennimyes hee hadde armye hee ledde modena hee hadde receyued three legion waye ventidius newe hadde fellowshippe lepidus wyth seauen legion armed wyth kynde furniture preparation requisite lepidus bare name among antonie direction shewed rome maruellous suddayne mutation mindes followed greate boldenesse fell feare great feare lifted vppe courage decree tenne men broken wyth spightealteration rome creation consulles instantelye called senate stoode doubte doe feared caesar antonie woulde agree sente secreatelye lucius pansa brutus andthe senate se deth lucius pansa brutus cassius cassius viewe publique playes sette foorthe grecia secreatlye required soone might bee woulde come helpe libya called twoo three legion vnder xtius thirde commaunded gyuen cornificiu ruler libya obeyed senate afrayde remembred theythe feare senate hadde serued vnder iulius caesar enclined hys doings doubtefulnesse droue pointe bycause feared newe caesar woulde consente wyth antonie nevve caesar chosen lie tenat decimus chose hym agayne verye vnfitlye lieutenaunte vnder detimus caesar anger continuallye vsed dispight stirred armye shoulde sente needye iorney paide fyue thousande drammes promised caesar stirreth souldioures againste senate fyrste counselled sende senate sent captaines bandes senate knowing wherefore taughte come aunswered woulde sende ambassadoures vnto whome thus instructed shoulde priuatelye speake twoo legion wente antonie teache puttesenate sendeth souldi truste one senate onelye whose power eternall shoulde goe decimus whither woulde sende theyr money pretended hadde readye gyue one halfe tenne men shoulde appointed payment namyng caesar eleuenth messenger bycause legion would spoken without caesar returned vaine caesar woulde haue speake souldioures tarrye anye longer himselfe wente armye beeyng assembled shewed despight senate done ment destroy euerye one caius caesar friendes badde beware woulde haue souldioures againste senate tourne capitayne sentence god iudged ennimy one ennimye another eyther bee vtterlye destroyed debate among themselues feate mutina common rewarde onelye appointed twoo legion worke strife discorde among knowe quoth hee antonie persecuted pompeyans haue propounded rome agaynste haue receyued giftes caesar appointement truste haue eyther lande money hee gaue safetye long kyllers kinsemen doe beare rule senate selfe readye take suche ende shall happen vnto shall myne honoure suffer father defence manye worthye men whole care beeyng perill father sake mine know cleare al ambition since refused authoritie woulde haue giuen ceremony magistrate nowe see bo e oure safety doeth desireth declared souldioures consist declared consull shall thing made sure vnto father hathe giuen landes habitation due vnto shall obtaine youre giftes vttermoste seeking punishment strihers wyth dispatche enimies hee hadde thus saide armye chearefully made noise sent capitaines againe rome require consulshippe caesar senate obiected hys age captaines instructed saide olde tyme coruinus consull hys tyme hymconsulls vnder age coruinus scipio scipio bath firste seconde youth countrey aduaunced comming later tyme broughte forth pompey dolobella caesar himselfe graunted consull tenne yeares beefore hys tyme capitaines speaking thus much boldenesse senatoures coulde abide beeyng bandleader vse suche free speech senate rebukedthe senate rebuketh souldioures menne insolent became souldioures duety whole armye heard angry desired might straighte led cittie might make caesar sonne consull famous election whose father extolled immortall praise octauius sawe vehemencie octauius th assemblye marched forward eight legion footeme sufficient number horseman prouision accordingly paste floude rubicone celtica italy father afore whe moued ciuil war deuided army ij part one commauded follow leysure ye better toke made much speede minding take vnprouided met part money senate sent souldiours rewarde afrayde bringers gifte sent secretiye afore afraye whereby wyth theirthe feare rome money fledde awaye report comming rome great trouble tumulte running hyther thyther sende wiues child carye chiefe substaunce eyther countrey strongest part citie throughly known whyther came onlye aske consulshippe heard came ennimy wyth angry armye afrayde al hand senate greatly stroken poweralteration rome sufficient suche feare happeneth one accesed bycause tooke awaye army antony wyth suche dispight bycause suspition triumphe whiche right hatred diuision money bycause appointed eleuenth manne distribution bycause reward giue neither soone ynough ful ynough sayd army become enimy blamed contention much season brutus cassius farre antonius lepidus ennimies nygh whome perceyuing redy agree wyth caesar made feare grow greater cicero great styrrer nowe cicero see appeare euerie manne maruellous mutation euerye matter two thousande fiue hundred dram shoulde giuen two legion giue fiue thousande drammes eight legion steede tenne men make caesar distributour alone graunte hym aske consulshippe absence ambassadours went haste inconstancie senate make thys message diligence towne senate repented oug cowardly troubled receiue another ran without bloudshed vse aske consulship force captaynes shoulde rule countrey pleasure citie shoulde arme themselues alleage lawes againste came inuade countrey woulde needes proceede rather suffer seege till decimus plancus myghte come better defend themselues death willingly receyue seruitude without redresse recyted olde example romanes sufferance counsell libertie whiche woulde wise giue ouer two legion called libya dyd day arriue porte thoughte god exhort mainteyne libertie repenting themselues woulde reuoke done cicero cicero seene agayne appearing among therefore men age appoynted serue two legion came libya wyth atvvo legion iue agayne thousande horse one legion pansa lefte putte togither whiche deuided one parte kepte hyll ianiculo theyr money lay another kepte passage floud officer citie deuiding themselues hadde broughte money porte shippes boates ouercome myght escape sea thus dyd greate boldnesse speede trustyng thereby affray caesar moue hym without army aske consulshippe manfully defende themselues state myghte change contrarie fortune whyles fyght libertie caesar mother sister coulde fynde neyther caesar mother sister sought priuie open search wherefore made greate stirre beeyng spoyled great pledge thoughte caesarian encline bycause surely hid messenger remayning yet wyth caesar contrarye determination tolde wherefore departed shame armye beeyng rather styrred came forwarde wyth greate hast fearing woman myghte take hurte people tumulte sente hys horseman afore willing bee afrayde whereat euery man reioysing tooke place aboue mount quirinale man daryng encounter resistemount quirinale one seuen hilles rome mutation rome hym wherefore maruelous mutation seene sodayne many noble menne wente vnto hym receyued hym common people folowyng vsinghonour gyuen octauian souldiours battayle raye men quiet peace hee leauyng hys armye place nexte daye came cittie sufficient garde aboute hym cittie mette wyth hym waye euery side saluted hym omittyng parte humanitie humble seruice mother hys sister temple vestae wythlegions senate goe caesar octauius holy nunnes ranne embrace hym three legion dispising theyr capitaynes sente embassadours vnto yeelde themselfe cornutus one theyr chiefe capitaynes cornutus killed hymselfe trusted hys promisse fayth cicero hearyng promyses practysed come hym hys friendes whiche beyng done excused hymselfe extolled perswasion hee vsed senate cicero hys consulshippe answeared onely taunt laste hys friendes came vnto nyghte sodayne rumour raysed twoo legion caesar martiall fourth reuolted cittie grieued brought betraye theirlight credite vayne rumor countrey officer senate gaue fayth vnto rumour lightly though army hand thought menne valiant might resist reste caesar hoste till power mighte come place nyghte sure senteancona acilius crassus picena gather armye commaunded one apuleius tribune runne people wyth thys ioyful tydings senate night came counsell cicero standing dore receyuing greate ioye gladnesse knowne false rumor fledde waye waggon caesar laughing broughte armye nygher citie place called fielde mar hurt none officer much crassus yt posting picene althougheacilius crassus hee broughte vnto hym seruile habite spared opinion hys humanitie albeit long put death common treasure founde ianiculo octauius dealing city place commaunded brought togither al afore appointed cicero distributed army two thousande fiue hundred drammes euery man residue promised giue done retyred citie till election consul chosen q pedius desired left portion octauius q pedius consul caesar inheritaunce vnto hym came cittie consul sacrifised appeared twelue gripe romulus token xii vulture builded cittie sacrifice ended hee gaue himselfe adoption father according lawe curiate confirmed adoption people romaine call curia company wardes peoplecur phratri deuided grecian call phratriae fellowshippes frater y vse among romaine effectuall lawe without father may well legitimate child commaunde kinsefolke free made men doe adopte one caius caesar glory manye riche free made men chiefly cause peraduenture thys caesar first adoption testament neede also dissolued newe lawe dolobella shoulde iudged rebell lawe mighte proceede caesar killing wherefore accusation written agaynste caesar caesar friend striker priuie thys obiected againste bycause woulde seene caesar kylled day certayne assigned proclamation shoulde appeare make annswere whiche fayling day caesar himselfe markyng iudgementes none par ed faulte one noble man hurte butmany conde ned caesar death shortly condemned deathe wyth thys tyme q gallius brother marius gallius antonyes friende q gallius condemned beeyng pretor citie dyd desire caesar lieutenantshippe libya whyche hadde obteyned wroughte wyles agaynste caesar pretor depriued hys office people senate condemned deathe caesar commaunded hym goe hys brother wyth antony taken shyppe goe neuer seene caesar done greate thing enclined pacification antony hearde brutus hadde twenty legios yt would haue antonyes help wente citie towarde ionian sea makyng small iourneys tarried see senate would pedius caesar gone perswaded grudge councell growe extremitie woulde agree antony lepidus although perceyued agreement theyr sake countrey onely helpe caesar agaynste brutus cassius yet necessitie determine reuoked sharp decree made antonie lepidus souldioures vnder sende fauourable whyche caesar wrote letter congratulation vnto promised helpe antonie againste decimus neede senate vsed lyke friendly manner rewardp cae gaue harty thakes antonie wrote would plague decimus caesar pl n himselfe ioyne caesar thus wrote one another whilest antonie pursued decimus asinius pollio came vnto two legion practised haue pacifyed plancus reconcyled vvith antony wyth plancus plancus three legion agreed antony muche nowe antony hadde myghtie power decimus hadde tenne legion whereof foure moste warlike feebled hunger yet vexed sickenesse newe taken syxe legion vnexperte fearefull wherefore decimus doubting fyghte determined decimus driue flee hys army forsaketh rauenna aquileia flee brutus macedonia passe mountaynes rauenna aquileia bycause caesar comming waye hee tooke longer harder r n floud italy runneth farre iourney passe rene goe wilde place barbarous people newe souldioures oppressed wante heate forsooke hym wente caesar foure legion older souldioures wente antony multitude frenche horseman men beeyng gard hys person except gaue leaue woulde goe euery man hys owne gaue golde hadde came rene decimus forsake three hundred bycause passage hard forsooke hym saue fewe whyche fewe also shortly dyd leaue hym wyth tenne onely changing hys garmente lyke french man whose language coulde speake wente forthe one nation ha ty iourneys easlie aquileia thynking fewe myghte wel escape beeyng taken theeues bounde asked prince taken vvith eues lorde parte sayde camillus muche esteemyng name camillus desired myght broughte hym whocamillus sawe hym apparance spake fayre hym rebuked taker without regard hadde euill entreated noble man priuily sent vnto antony antony mouedbarbarous killed one camillus commaundemente mutation coulde abyde see willed camillus kyll hym sende hym hys head whyche sawe commaunded buryed thys ende hadde decimus captayne caesar horseman na hym made ruler olde france yeare come elected consull gouernoure fraunce seconde kyllers nexte trebonius punished yeare halfe caesar deathe verye tyme minutius basill one caesar quellers also killed minuti basil killed ovvne men hys owne seruauntes bycause made eunuch punishmente ende thirde booke ciuill dissentions p fourth booke appiane alexandria ciuill dissentions rome thus two caesar killer ouerthrowen prouinces punishment trebonius asia decimus celtica nowe cassius brutus chiefe conspiracie caesar plagued lordes lande betweene syria macedonia hauing mighty power sea land twenty armed legtons besyde horseman shyppes money wyll thys fourth booke ciuill discorde shal declare inquisition searcher appoynted dye proscription lamentable affliction euerye condemnation lavve kill men vvheresoeuer founde syde suche neyther among greeke sedition tumultes among romaine themselues hadde bin done remembrance sauing onely sylla fyrste proclamation condemned hys foe dye marius onely seeke punishe whome founde sylla greate rewardes lyke punishmentes conceale proscribed menne caughte marius sylla dyd shewed matter nowe rest shall follow order caes r antonie enimies made friendes aboute e e citie modene little playne ilande floude lab eache hauyng fyue armed legion whiche beyng placed one oueragaynste another eyther wyth three hundred came bridge riuer lepidus beeing come afore searche ile made token wyth hys cloke come lefte theyr companyes wyth theyr friendes bridge came myddest place myghte bee seene sate three downe caesar myddest bycause office two dayes mornyng tyll nyghte conferred made thys determination caesar gyus ouer hys consulshippe ventidius receyue rest yeare newe office shoulde instituted lawe redresse ciuill trouble lepidus antonius caesar shoulde haue authoritie fyue yeares wyth power consulles haue thought best name peraduenture bycause antonyes decree forbiddyng anye man bee dictator shoulde appoynte office citie yeare yeare duryng fyue yeares diuide prouinces antony shoulde haue fraunce thys syde thenovv narbona pirenei mountaynes excepte whiche call olde celtica lepidus shoulde rule spayne caesar shoulde gouerne lybia sardinia sicelie ilande thus three diuide romaine empire leauing prouinces beyonde sea bycause brutus cassius gouernoures antony caesar make warre vpon brutus cassius lepidus shoulde consull time come remayne citie occasion gouerne spayne deputy lepidus shoulde reteyne three legion owne army defence rome seauen shoulde diuided betweene caesar antony caesar shoulde haue three antony foure eyther myghte leade twentye legion warre shoulde encourage armyes well rewardes victorie giftes promise eyghteene city italie excelling substance yle fayre buyldings landes house shoulde deuided vnto though bin taken warre amongst rest chiefe cap reggi ven sia beneuent nuceria arimeno vibona city italy deuided spoyle thus fayrest partes italie assigned souldioures also agreed euery shoulde dispatche hys priuate enimies trouble myghte come vppon determination shoulde bee gene farre make long warre countrey thyngs signed wyth handes casar consull dyd declare armye sauyng onely theyr name appoynted dye souldioures hearde glad embraced togither ioy beeyng done many monster terrible tokenstokens rome seene rome dogges yeelled like wolues fearefull warning wolues ranne common place beast wonte seene rome oxe sounded man voyce childe spake soone borne image sweate dyd sweate bloud greate voyces men noyse harnesse running horse hearde nothyng seene aboute sunne manye vnpleasante sightes stormes also stone continuall lightning fell vppon temple picture thys cause senate sente southsayers prophetes auntiente whyche affirmyng olde kyngs shoulde returne euery man ina rare example southsayer bondage himselfe alone shutte mouth stopped hys breath tyll dyed three men beyng thus alone themselues dyd appoynte shoulde dye suspected power registred theyr priuate enimies theyr owne familiar friendes gaue dye serue eache others turne afterwarde men condemned one another enemitie onely little offence louing hys enimies hatyng hys friendes beeyng riche bycause wanted much money maynteyne warre brutus cassius receyuing rente tribute asia beeyng also holpen kynges prince asmuche wante bycause europe chiefely italie wasted wyth warres paymentes dyd put greeuous imposition vpon common sorte menne woman made artificer workemen pay tribute proscribed goodnesse hys land house thus condemned dye bee confiscate whereof thereequites three hundred senator two thousande bee called gentleman among whyche breethren vncles hadde condemned ruled army vnder many hadde displeased leader vnder intendyng condemne multitude conference theyr beeyng rome appoynted twelue suddayne say seauenteene chiefest bee kylled whereof cicero one sente aboute foure straight kylled theyr table mette soughte house temple sudden trouble al night among cry running andmiserie rome yelling citie taken knowen menne shoulde bee apprehended certenty vppon whome proscription woulde fall euery man thoughte himselfe bee sought made enquirie wherefore confusion hadde determined burne owne thynges sette publike place fyre intending good reason doe notable feate woulde suffer hadde done hande hadde pedius consull gone aboute proclamation comforted tarrie till truth throughly knowen morning come pedius according sentence three men condemne seauenteene supposed chiefe author ciuill euils onely condemned whereof gaue faith act vniust cruell sore considering caesar haue suffered handes caesar chief ruler prince holy thing conquerour ouerthrower nation terrible romaine first man beyond hercules pillers proue sea sayled haue sente detestable offendours steede punishment rule prouinces army whiche abuse spoyling common treasure gatheryng one army v requiring barbarian alwayes enimies state certaine citties belongyng romanes refusing obey haue burned spoyled rased others oppressed terrible threatnings force agaynst countrey v wee haue already punished helpe god ye shall soone see rest haue ste deserte greatest matter touchyng spayne fraunce home haue commaundement well dispatched neuerthelesse wee haue harde sharpe worke hande make warre agaynst murderer caesar e beyonde sea bicause wee shall make warre abrode thinke sure neyther v leaue enimies home mighte disturbe v absence wayfe theyr time warre shoulde haue successe neyther make delay hasty expedition rather ridde one hauyng begonne warre agaynst v iudged v army traytours countrie regardyng neyther enuy manne reuengment god destroying many million citizen wee offended agaynst multitude take enimies haue bene v altogither weigh rich substaunce dignity kill many chiefe ruler haue done v redressed citie lyke ciuill dissentions whome lucky doings call happie although muste needes enimies three one onely worste moste wicked sorte well selfes wee entende correct otherwise contention betweene v muste needes vtterly destroyed necessitie armie hath bene iniuried despighted haue bene proclaimed publique enimies must needes way comforted hande wee mighte lay handes vppon condemned wee woulde yet thought better pronounce aduentures oppresse sake least rage souldiours mighte exceede vppon touched name beyng comprehended certayne number might leaue rest decree good fortune may come conteyned wryting lette manne receyue manne hyde sende away wonne money doe saue helpe founde pryuye without excuse par ie put among condemned sorte shall dryng heades suche shall kyll v free manne shall haue xxv thousand drammes athens euery heade seruaunt shall hauerevvardes hys lybertie tenne thousande hys maysters place cittie shall haue shall enforme brother friend familiar herents fleeyng bote e could abyde sicknesse sea returned place owne whiche remembraunce hys misfortune see aboute capu cittie italy came seeke hym hande antonie moste desirous put cicero litter ledde toward sea thicke wood rode secreatly many run euery side asking sawe cicero good pittie saide gone sailed ouer sea shomaker tenaunt clodie thea shomaker e vvrayeth cicero father sonne fightyng togither dyed one wounde heades striken body yet embrace balbus sent sonne sea shoulde espied balbus hys sonne going togither shortely followed aloofe one tolde either malice ignorance sonne taken went backe sent killer chaunced son drowned sea like calamitie fortune giue aruntius coulde hardelye perswade sonne would aruntius sonne flee without saue himselfe bycause yong mother sent afore gate retourned burye hir husbande killed hearde shortely afterhis vvife hir sonne deade sea hunger shee killed hirselfe example good euill child ij brother condemned called ligari beeing ligari tvvo brother hidde fel asleepe til one found hys seruants killed making escape hearing hys brother death threwe himselfe bridge riuer whome fyshermen saued one fell chance purpose stroue great shoulde saue threwe himselfe vnder water stronger bringing vppe safe saide haue saued put selues daunger death condemned man yet hauing pittie saued hym til souldiors kepte bridge saw ran cut heade two brother one threw himselfe riuer histvvo brother seruaunt seekyng body fiue dayes whiche founde knewe cut head reward brother hid sake seruaunte bewraye souldioures refused goe weapon speares pulled vp body cutte hie head suche case another vnderstanding brother proscribed andtvvo brother knowing hymselfe ranne cryed kyll hym captayne knowyng truth condemnation thou makest resonable request quoth thou wast condenmed hym order kylled example broethren ligarius beeyng hydde hys wyfe made one onely maydea good vvife hath euill lucke priuie beeyng betrayed hir followed bare away hir husbandes head cry must haue like punishmente bycause haue hydde hym none souldyoures woulde kyll hyr accuse hir wente bewray hir selfe prince bycause regarde hyr pitie destroyed hir selfe minturno vvhere marius vvas hidde whiche toke rest minturnians searching fenne theese toppes reedes wauering bewrayed varus taken cofessed felon vpon whiche condemned ledde away haue bene racked
