fledde floude nar retyred winter hande figulus thinking might sodaine disperse themromanes dry floud narus delminium den droue place till came citie delminium whereof dalmatian haue name coulde doe nothing citie sodaine raise engine heigth wall went abroade againe destitute vnfurnished wasting aboute delminium made certaine pearches two cubites long laide ouer pitch sulpher towe sling threwe delminium fyred violence anddeuise figul like lamp fleeing aire set fire whatsoeuer touched many consumed fire wherof ended war figulus time following cecilius metellus consul cecilius metellus triumpheth nothing illyrian offended nothing woulde needes make warre triumphe whome receiued friendly remayning salon cittie winter triumphed nothing salon assyrian pollig called sonne salonus promo caesar made warre vppon celtians dalmatian flourished tooke citie illyrian called promon belonged lyburnians lyburnians gaue themselues romanes fled caesar caesar sent embassador exhorting restore om n lyburnians caesar army ouerthrovvne illyrian desp sing sent army ouerthrown illyria caesar occupied care sedition pompey folowing nothing sayled wt whole armye contrary tempest try ye matter pompey macedonia rest army antonie brought caesar macedonia inthe illyrian destroy armye gabinius beingeth caesar gret tempest gabinius assayed caesar xl band footman iij horsmen illyria ye illyrian feare done thinking victorie caesar would confusion resisted gabinius slew al saue fewe fled got great deale money infinite spoile caesar dissembled thys necessitie war pompey pompey ouercome caesar went dispatch al rest returned rome determined war againste g te parthian illyrian heard feared caesar would take te people sey ia europe called daci divided daci nexte germany vvhom call vvhich seruile behauior vsed name seruaunts comedy way parthia sent embassador rome aske pardon faultes extolled worthie nation illyrian would become friendes caesar minded go parthian answered sharpely would haue friendes vsed vnfriendly yet woulde spare woulde paye tribute pledge promising bothe hee sente atinius three legion great band horseman take pledge small tribute caesar dead thought power rome would die refused obey atinius neither paying tribute giuing hostage atinius se ding v band ouercame leader bebius ouercome durazzo prouinces brutus c cast u bebius senatour atinius reste fledde epidamno senate appointed brutus c cassius killed caesar macedonia illyria syria making warre wyth antonie caesar called augustus ye illyrian paeone pannonia novve g rie quietnesse paeones gret nation inhabiting alongst hister stretcheth iaepodans dardones called paeones grecian romanes pannonians wee haue sayde bee called parte illyrian speake somewhat beeyng aboutagrian shew illyrian state glorie much ye agrians macedonian comming paeonia great seruice vnder philip alexander cornelius ouerthrowne cornelius ouerthrovven agrians al army fame paeonians waxed gret made italie afraide therfore long time consulls woulde take vppon warre paeonians great thing haue founde illyrian caesar commentary augustus ovvne actes commentary called augustus finde auntient matter ye paeonians seeme part illyria obey romanes name tel augustus didde write men actes owne howe brought reuolted empyre tribute ouercame liued vnder law lastely conquered barbarous nation dwell heigth mountaines nexte italie vsed stealth molest surely maruell manye army passing rome ouer alpes contemne nation caius caesar happy man warre leading manye army againste celtes iberian likewise little passe nation lay euery winter far space tenne yeares thinke menne making haste onely purchased care passage ouer alpes c caesar long celtica thought ynough end ciuill warre pompey calling caesar passe illyria rest seemed chose celtica illyria tooke rule belonged ye romanes caesar augustus got al accused ydlenes antonie senate shewed made fierce caesar augustus talketh hys conquest illyrian nation illyria subdued augustus nation ye illyrian oft rebelling tame subdued great experience ye oxeans perthenetans bathiates taulantians cambians cinambrans merromen n prisseans yt rebelled docleatans carinians interfrurians narisians clintidions tauris an compelled pay tribute denied whiche ouercome nexte melita malta corcyra corfu cruelly vsed augustus ipp sinans bessians feare yeelde vnto hee ouercame corcyrians melitinans greate fight sea bicause rouers sea child killed hee solde tooke shippes liburnians bicause also robbed sea iapodans dwel within alpesmoentines aedetians aurupians moentines aedeatians yeelded came aurupians whiche many warlike iapodan kind went oute country cittie came lurked wooddes tooke citie would set afyre thinking would yeeld length beeing salas iapodes segestan dalmatia daisi paeones alpes done gaue citie inhabite al salassans iapodans dwell beyonde alpes made haue moste segestanes dalmatian daisians paeonans ioyned keepe toppes hilles bee mountaines vnpassable harde narrowe way leading truste whereof liue themselues take toll ofveterus passe veterus comming sodainelye vppon gote straightes place policie besieged twoo yeares wanting salte wherof need receiued garrisonsvvant salte rebelling veterus casting desences got streights laughed caesar sent bicause could little therefore caesar beginning warre antonie lette liue woulde forgaue molested obeyed romanes tillmessala coruinus messala coruinus sent caesar subdue ouercame famine salassians came romanes power iapodans inhabite beyond alpes fierce nation almoste wilde didde reiecte romanes twice xx aquileia novv venetian iurisdiction torgius yeares ra nged aquileia spoyled romanes land called torgius caesar wente againste fierce agaynste hym cut wood stop caesar went wood fled followed caesar augustus defeateth iapodans layde traines caesar suspecting sent hys toppes hilles sette vppon bothe side comming easly cutting wooddes sodainely appeared traines hurte many come toppes destroyed reste flodde wooddes againe leauing citie whose name terponus terponus caesar tooke burne neither thinking also woulde render didde went cittie whiche call metulio chiefe city iapodans metulio scituate vppon two hilles wooddy place betweene whiche little valley goeth youth number three thousande well practised armes easily repell romanes walles romanes set vppon mounte whiche within withoute runnyng daye nighte didde muche hinder hauyng engine whyche hadde gotten warre whereby made romaynes lye hadde gotten theyr enginesengines taken place vvhere brutus cassius fought vvith caesar antony place brutus foughte caesar antonie romanes hadde beaten downe parte theyr walles made fortes within wearye leapt nowe made romanes taking wall hadde lefte burnedbrydges made mountes vvals break sette two mountes whiche made also foure bridge walles readye caesar badde goe side citie drawe citizen asunder willed goe vppon bridge stoode looked vppon highe tower done barbarian came resiste gaue assaulte wall laying traynes behinde beating bridge long speares waxed fierce two bridge broken thirde lyke fall romanes suche feare none woulde go fourth caesar rebuked tower woulde neuerthe boldnesse caesar august sooner goe wherefore tooke shield ran bridge agrippa hierom lucius capitaines volas one guard iiij fewe tergatebearers went bridge caesar bridge souldioures ashamed ranne straighte vnto reason whereof bridge ouer laden brake manye fell grounde whiche dyed caesar beeyng hurtethe fourth bridge breaketh caesar urte right leg arme went tower chiefe following yt might shewe himselfe euidently beeprudence caesar augustus aliue least tumulte might made death enimies thinke fled commanded bridge made thing chiefly made metulians afraide next day sending embassador peace promised deliuer v c pledge receiue garriso leauing higher hill al went garrison comanded leaue armor grieued putting wiues child senatehouse receyuing garrison tolde romanes required vnreasonable thing would burne place set vpon romanes desperationdesperate metal said al went lowe place higher garrison set house afyre many woman killed themselues child broughte child aliue threw fire al youth metulians perished battaile vnprofitable sort fire city burned great toke lefte metulians ouercome rest iapodans yeelded caesar thus iapodans beyond alpes became subiecte romanes caesar gone posseman possenians metulians rebelled marcus elbius ouercame killed cause rebellion made rest slaues romanes hauing gone twice ye segestanes neither tooke hostage paeonians vvaye segestanes thing else wherefore boldened caesar went paeonian land wer yet obedient romanes land woddy stretcheth alog iapodans dardanans paeontans haue city land house togither common justicepaeonians haue city common place iustice muche people vvithout head caesar burneth village prince rule ouer c fighting men best yeres bicause none command came togither whe caesar came ran wooddes found stragling killed caesar thinking wold haue come neither burne field village bicause came set sire eight dayes togither much harme passed floude sa u saeunus runneth mountaynes danubius banke whiche cittie strong floude great ditche wherfore caesar assaulted store house warre daceans bastarnans dwell beyond hister floude place called danubius going lower place hath name hister sa u nethhister danubius caesar shippes floude might bryng victuall armie danubio caesar would haue citie segesta went forward segestanes sent embassadourssegesta vnto know doe willed receyue garrison deliuer pledge might haue daci scythian europe novv vallachia citie store house warre daceans much corne could bring chiefe men thought good people began rage cared thethe people segesta refuseth garrison hostage bicause great garrison came could abide see ranne vpo furiously shutte gate shewed themselues agayne vpon walles wherefore caesar made bridge euer floudde raysed trench ditch shut citie erected two mountes hindred much might could defeate mountes threwe fire burning linkes vpo fro higher place ayde comming nation paeonians whome caesar layee ambush killed parte parte fledde came helpe segestans enduring siege valiantly ouercome xxx day harde fight learned make supplication whose ver ue caesar spared segestanes valiantues caesar marueling moued pitie prayer kill otherwise molest punished purse placed outwarde parte citie put thirtie band garrison done wentfalse rumor causeth caesar haue vvinter iourney rome returne againe illyria tolde segestanes slayne garrison whiche citie came agayne speede though winter hearing rumor false vnderstoode truth daunger segetanes sodainly sette vppon segestanes destroyed garison killed many next day souldiours giuen onset vpon citizen gotten citie wherfore taulantians lea g lande vvent part macedonia next gulfe enise far durassa city ar sse dalmatian novv slauonians ouerthrovv gabinius versus captaine turned warre dalmatian nation illyrian next taulatians dalmatian giuen ouerthrowe fiue bandes vnder gabinius taken fiue ensignes proude prosperitie armour ten yeares togither caesar came decreede helpe segestanes aboue good fighting made one versus captaine inuaded pomona citie yt liburnians defensed trenche ditch got strong place yt country al hillie toppes whereof stand vp like pynacles greater part citie rest kept hil toppes mighte easily see romanes armye caesar dessembled thoughe would enclose al wall priuily bad bolde sorte go mountaynes espie done going wood secretly night set vpon kepers yet asleepe killed signifyed caesar end iourney must haue men get citie let go hils tel others mountaines wherfore barbarian put great feare saw themselues beset euery side chiefly higher hils lacke waterlack vvater fearing wayes would shut side got pomona caesar enclosed citie two highest hylles yet holden enimies xl furlong meane season gaue onset vpon teutinus another captaine ofteutinus dalmatian put flight chased mountaines toke citie sight citizen coming preparation finished repulse romanes flight got citie pomona taken slaine third part citizen droue rest castle one bande romanes kept gat vppon barbarian issewed fourth night afrayd forsoke gate caesar came repulsed enimies next day yeelded augustus punished souldiours band offended punished euery tenth man lot captaines yt band chastised two euery ten sommer comaunded eate barley stead wheate thus pomona taken teutinus diuided army diuerse part hilsteutinus wherefore romanes folow farre ignoraunt way fearing vnknowen consounded pathes entrie wood plain way dalmatian lurke two hils layd wayte gobinius place set also ambushe caesar burned wood eyther side way caesar hurneth vvooddes sent army hils himselfe went vp vallies cutting downe wood inuading
